name: linabperez_
text: Love this place!!! Doggie training is really good and professional she gives you a lot of tips with one on one classes as well. It’s also fun for the dogs and safe. Definitely worth it.

resp.text: Thank you Lina!  It was a pleasure working with you and Rachel.  :)

name: cheryl gwin
text: Great place for your doggies! Your fur babies will be well taken care of, run and play their hearts out, and have the time of their life! Whether it's for boarding or doggie day care you can't lose with Red Dog Ranch.

name: cheryl gwin
text: Best place ever for your pooch!  You can rest easy knowing your dog is in good hands when you bring them to the ranch.

name: Bretta Cagle
text: Amazing place for your dogs. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks Bretta!  Sure do love having the girls stay at the Ranch 💕

name: Joe Anderson
text: What an amazing place to board your dog. Gracie's has learned to.play with other dogs by hanging out.at the ranch.

name: Eve Anderson
text: This place is unbelievably wonderful!  I am in the Shoals, AL area frequently for work.  This wonderful pupper oasis allows me to bring my sweet pup Maggie along with me.  She’s always depressed for a couple days when we return home to Chicago, because she feels so at home - as well as physically & mentally engaged at the ranch.  The owner / operator is actually a dog trainer, and I’m seeing Maggie pick up some great habits each day after her playtime.  Thank you sincerely, for all that you do for Maggie and I.

name: Eric McGee
text: Boarding without hours spent kenneled. Fields to run, pools to stay cool, and other dogs to play with. I think we missed our puppy more than she missed us!

name: Chris Whealen
text: Just an awesome experience and I know my pup had a great time. Very reasonable rates as well.

resp.text: Thanks Chris!  We really enjoyed keeping Elvis at the Ranch, and glad to hear he enjoyed himself as well. 😉

name: Misty Campbell
text: Very pleased with Frank, Jamie, and all the great people at Belle Shain!!  I contacted Frank when I was about at my wit’s end with our puppy, Cross.  He was biting/chewing excessively (on me mostly), he was unable to walk on a leash, and he was just not doing well.  Within a matter of weeks, Frank and his team have taught Cross how to behave better, he has learned commands, and he is a more pleasant dog to be around.  I can tell Cross loves being at Belle Shain, too. He enjoys playing with other dogs, running around, and swimming in the river. Definitely helpful for training and burning off all of that puppy energy!

name: Annie Summers
text: I trained my two dogs Dixie and Maddie with Frank and Jamie at Belle Shain Kennels. It has made a huge difference in how much enjoyment I get from my dogs now they will sit, heel and place. I highly recommend their training facility. My dogs love it there. I still take my  them for kenneling when I travel and day care boarding too. Frank does tune ups on Saturdays at the Woof Bar, I think that’s more tuning up the trainer than the dog🐶. Great people and wonderful property for the dogs to play.

name: Stacey Bottorff
text:
Great training and boarding program! Our dog spent about 3 months with Frank working on general obedience and then progressing from there. He is very knowledgeable and patient, incorporating training sessions with my husband and I throughout the months as well. Our dog enjoyed her time there!
During her time there our dog also required some vet attention (preexisting issue) and Frank did not hesitate to get her into his vet for care. Would definitely recommend Frank and his training program to other dog owners!

name: Daniel Campbell
text: Frank and the gang at Belle Shain are nothing short of fantastic. They are very accommodating and do a great job at a very reasonable price. Our dog was young, very energetic, and rambunctious. They are successfully turning him into a much better mannered young dog. He gets lots of exercise and loves playing with other dogs and swimming in the river (under supervision). He is excited to jump out of the truck he gets there every Monday morning and is obviously very well treated at Belle Shain. I can not recommend them enough.

name: Chase Emerson
text:
Frank and his crew were outstanding!!
They had my dog trained very quickly, and efficiently.
Not to mention they treat all the animals very well. I will use them in the future over anyone else!!

name: Kyle Maxwell
text: Frank and his crew did an amazing job training my dog and treated her very well.

name: Chris Wade
text: No other place I would take my dogs. Frank did an awesome job with both of my dogs. Use him for boarding when we go out of town. Dogs have a blast and get excited when we pull in the driveway!

name: Abigail Jackson
text: Clipper has had a blast this summer at training and boarding camp. He has learned so much and is now off leash. I have seen a total transformation in Clipper’s behavior and attitude. Frank and Staff are amazing to work with and really get to know and care about your dog. I am forever thankful for BelleShain Kennels.

name: Billy Hollis
text: Very friendly, and they really care about your fur baby. My family moved here from Nevada and we needed a good, honest veterinarian that care about animals and wants the best for them. This place was all of that. I am so thankful to have found them. The Doctor was super friendly and explained everything as did her assistant that was always in the room with me and my precious Daisy.  I thank God for leading me to a great doctor that really does love and care about animals.

resp.text: Daisy is a sweet kitty and we are certainly glad she is on her way to feeling better. Thank you for trusting us with her care. 🐾

name: Marnie Weaver
text: Dr. Jubb has been my pets vet for a while. We recently moved 3 hours away and I drove all the way back to have my fur baby treated. They treat my baby just like their own ❤

resp.text: Thank you for letting us care for your family!! We certainly hope your baby is feeling better. 🐾

name: Tiffany Thomas
text: I brought my dog Lincoln in with a swelled face. Turns out he had an absessed tooth. The staff had him feeling better and had us in and out in thirty minutes with his medication! I highly recommend them!

resp.text: So happy he is feeling better. Thank you for allowing to tend to him! 🐾

name: Jennie Swafford
text: We have just arrived in the city of Florence. A neighbor referred us to this facility. We relocated from out of state. They took us on as a client. Our dog was very comfortable with the surroundings and not anxious with any of the staff. The place is very clean and comfortable. The staff took time to welcome us and find out our needs. The technican was very friendly and very attentive in listening to the history of our dog. Explained everything that was to happen, answered all of our questions and told us about the facility and doctors. Very impressed with the doctor. We plan to make this our vets and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a vet in the Florence area. Dr. Baggett was great and explained everything to us. We will definitely be back with our dog Holly.

name: Natalie Aldridge
text: Dr. Baggett got my little man on the road to recovery! He explained everything in detail, and what we would do next, if needed. I had zero questions about the care my Jalen was getting. The staff is wonderful, especially reception. They make you feel like you’re right at home. I highly recommend!

resp.text: 🐾 Glad J baby is better 🐶 🤍

name: Jeneen Bowen
text: Dr. Jubb is the Best with any animal. Loving, kind, down to earth and yet skilled and knowledgeable!!! We absolutely love her, her daughter and the rest of the team. We’ve been taking our animals there over 25 years and will continue ❤️

resp.text: Thank you for always trusting us with each of your family members. Thankful to have been part of their care for many years!

name: Rebecca Swinea
text: Oscar's problem was explained and addressed.  I was given instructions to prevent a recurrence.

name: Patsy Sharp
text: I was very satisfied with the care of my new puppy,thay were super friendly and took the time to explain everything to me about the care of my puppy and throughly explained how to give his medicine,thay made me feel that my puppy was being treated the best!!! Thank you!!!!!♥️🌸

resp.text: I am so glad that we were able to help your fluffy boy! Looking forward to seeing him grow. 🐾

name: Jill Patterson
text:
I've been using West Lauderdale Veterinary Clinic since 2004. Dr Jubb and her staff have always been attentive to my pets needs in a timely, professional
and caring manner. Without reservation,  I highly recommend them.

name: Scot F
text: They turned away my sick cat did have appointment but who can make a appointment every time when your animal is sick you got no choice but to take your animal to a doctor they were very rude and turned me and my cat away  just blows me away a vet can turn away paying customers in there time of need animals don't get sick on are time they just get sick . Your one place  place

resp.text: Our doctors and medical team rotate lunches and there is a small window when we are not able to see outpatients. When your cat was presented to our office today was during that window. Our receptionist stated that we would be glad to get your pet worked in but it would be a 30 minute wait. The lady that brought your pet chose to try another location that could see her immediately. We try and accommodate all of our clients and patients needs, but sometimes it is necessary that a small wait occur.

name: Julia Layman
text: This is by far the best place to take your animals to,they treat you and your pet like family,not just a business,they take time to answer all your questions.i will continue using them as my pets vet!!!,thank you for the great care of my snowshoe!!!

name: Eddie Thigpen
text: I always feel goid about leaving my Lila at West Lauderdale Veterinarian!  They are always caring and do all they can to meet our needs!

name: Taylor Rowe
text: I was blown away by the helpful staff, wonderful customer service and the vet! Dr. Jubb and Ashley sat down and explained what was going on with my pup and exactly what to do to take care of her. I have been to many vets over the years and this is by far the best experience! I will be making them my vet from now on!

resp.text: We are so glad to hear you had a wonderful experience with us! We certainly appreciate you allowing us to care for your pup! Have a great New Year and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

name: rebstroh haberstroh
text: Amazing service from the entire staff. Had an emergency Saturday visit after our dog was bitten by another dog while visiting the lake. Our dog is normally  anxious while visiting his vet but Dr Hale and her crew kept him calm and got him fixed up. In and out within 20 minutes very reasonable priced.  They also went out of there way to email everything they had  diagnosed and prescribed so we would have for our home vet. Highly recommend super  compassionate care.

name: McKinna Palmer
text: Dr. Judd and her staff could not be any kinder. They took such good care of my baby today and saw him with a very small wait. This is definitely our new vet home.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review! Glad you had a great experience and we were able to help you quickly!

name: Melinda Hargett
text: I have used WLVH for many years. Very kind and compassionate people, especially Dr. Jubb.

name: Debbie Banes
text: Friendly & knowledgeable staff! Dr Jubb is an obvious animal lover and takes care of our pets like they are her own.

name: Trace Times
text: Receptionists are very friendly. The vet was somewhat pushy and was not very receptive to questions about where you money was going.

name: Britt
text: Poor customer service, this vet is more concerned with money than health of the animals. Refused to approve a prescription from a known pharmacy due to not accepting "3rd party requests". Didn't tell us this until after paying the $450 for 2 dogs' annual vaccinations. Take the extra time to drive further for vet who cares about the actual health of the animal.

name: Gary Utley
text: We have trusted Dr. Jubb and her staff for over 25 year's.

name: Leslie Brown
text: Very nice vet. Looking forward to going back.

name: Georgeann Hester
text:
Since I did not receive any comment or follow-up after contacting Pet Palace directly, I thought I would share my experience here. I boarded my kitty for July 4th weekend; it was her first time being boarded.

When I picked her up, she was skeletally thin, which I did not notice until I took her out of her carrier when I got home. Granted, she had lost a little bit of weight before I brought her for boarding, but not a noticeable amount. I had already planned on taking her to the vet as soon as I was back in town, but I was never notified during her time at Pet Palace that she was not eating (it was pretty obvious to me that she had not eaten those 4 days for her to be so skinny). I may have come back sooner to pick her up and take her to a vet or requested that someone drive her to a local vet at my expense. She ended up being diagnosed with Feline Infectious Peritonitis, which you may know is a fatal disease in cats. While I have been able to treat her for it, if we had known even a few days earlier, I would have been able to start treating her earlier, and she may not have been hospitalized for three days or needed a blood transfusion just a couple days after picking her up from Pet Palace.

I am not blaming Pet Palace for giving her FIP; this isn't the case at all. I'm just really disappointed with the lack of communication. I wasn't told even when I picked her up that she had not eaten during her stay. I hope that this is not something that happens to any future kitty parent who boards with Pet Palace.

name: John Wells Warren
text: Nick the Wonder Dog loves Pet Palace. He is my 14-year-old Border Collie who was the official church dog at St. Dunstan’s for 12 years.

name: Debbie Simril
text: Love, love, love Pet Palace!  Our fur-babies have always been treated with great care and attention.  I also love the ala-carte items that you can add for extended stays.  Professional and courteous staff!  Great experience every time!  Thank you!

name: Donna Stewart
text: Don't go there. I use to work there. The owner does not treat the animals or her employees well. Go anywhere else but pet palace. I am in legal trouble with the IRS because my tax form was messed up, the wrong SSN was put on my form, and she is refusing to help me. I know of an old Co-Worker who had to threaten to sue and go in with a Police Officer to get her last paycheck. She does not properly train employees on how to handle dogs. One time while working I got bit by a cat...my entire arm swelled up and felt like it was on fire! But she said it wasn't bad enough for me to go to the doctor.  She expects the groomers to groom 8 dogs a day! (at least that how many we did) and there was only 2 of us. It was way too much! We were so rushed for time that we could not be nice.......yeah they may come out looking nice, but your dog did not enjoy that groom. Don't go there.

name: Stephen Wilkerson
text: It still doesn’t sit well with me how this place handled my parents after they lost both of our dogs while we went on a trip! We had to cut the trip early after just one day, we come back to pick the dogs up after they were found and didn’t receive a discount or even an apology! We had to take the dogs to the vet and pay for diarrhea treatment and treatment of their paws! They paid for nothing not to mention the trip we missed out on that was very expensive! I wouldn’t recommend anyone ever use this place! Very unprofessional, uncaring, anything! Should have been put out of business long ago

name: Willie “BassMan!” Joyner
text: Great place for all of your pet needs.

name: Nonie Thompson
text: They cut all my pets hair off!!! Even when they had been grooming her for a long time! No communication- they had a photo to go by, and I had asked for one person always to groom my dog this day she did not! Very disappointed! Look at the photos I posted! 😳

name: Lori Cook
text:
DO NOT take your pet here!!

Thought it would be a great way for our (6) month old Aussie to spend the day -
Boy - was I wrong!

They are definitely not what they advertise -
Pulled our pup out after (3) days
And will never go back!

name: India Powell
text:
If I could give them zero stars, I would.

I took my Great Pyrenees to Pet Palace recently. She’s been there before so we assumed we would get the same quality grooming service.

When we picked her up, her fur was matted to the skin. I believe they didn’t brush her properly and cage dried her. Not only that - there was also a cut behind her ear where they trimmed her hair.

We gave them our number for the groomer to call us and they never did. We didn’t receive any kind of explanation or a refund, which would have been the right thing to do.

We ended up taking her to Moore’s Mill Animal Hospital (which also has a grooming service) and they were able to get most of the mats out. Some of her hair had to be trimmed on her back. However, they were wonderful and we’ll be taking her there from now on.

I am livid. The lack of professionalism is appalling and I trusted them to take care of my dog. If they can’t  find a proper groomer or have better practices for caring for their dogs, then they don’t need to be in business.

It was a very horrible experience and I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone.

name: Angie Ebosele
text: The facility was great. Ollie came home clean and smelling great after his bath too! The only issue was that I don’t believe they fed him his food that I left with him. He had diarrhea all night, and it lasted about 2 days total. The only other time it’s happened was when I first got him and had to figure out which food he liked the most. I called to see if they kept records after each feeding; she said no, but there was a note saying he had his own food. She even said her dog was fed boarding food. That means he was either fed the wrong food or had diarrhea because of something else.

name: Arcquanita Chandler
text: Great friendly service. My baby looked amazing and smelled fabulous. I will be back monthly

name: Alex Burkett
text: Awesome place, weren't super upfront about pricing. Not unreasonable just got suprised when I picked up my pups. Whatever they use to bathe your dog is incredible.

name: Julie Rutter
text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I boarded one of my dogs here a few months ago and all was well.
I have 2 dogs now & needed boarding while we went out of town for a funeral. I called and was told my adult dog could stay w/our puppy in the same kennel For one price, $27. When I dropped them off the same thing was repeated to me as I was contemplating separating the dogs. The girl assured me they would watch them the first day and if there were issues they would separate them and only charge for 2 kennels on the nights they had to be separated.
I picked them up on Sunday and was told they did great and were together the whole time. However, I was billed for a separate kennel each night. I asked the girl at the desk about it and she also happened to be the one who checked them in, quoted me $27 per night per kennel, not per dog and said she checked with another employee and confirmed they could share for one price. I asked her to call the owner because I didn't feel like you should write one price and charge another at the end. She called Jenny, the owner, and Jenny told her it was $27 per night, per dog. She  called Jenny back so I could speak to her and explain to her what I was told. Jenny saw it was her employee calling and she answered the phone "Is she giving you trouble? " I explained to Jenny who I was and what I was told. She talked over me, would hardly let me speak, told me I was confused and no one there would have ever given me those prices... Even though the girl was sitting right there apologizing for giving me the wrong information. She remembered doing it and still thought today that the price was per kennel and not per dog. She told me another employee also thought that. There were also three other customers in the lobby who heard it. I paid the full price but I won't take my dogs back. I've never seen an owner argue with a customer like she did. She was rude and disrespectful, as well as intimidating to her employees. I think her employees are young and just do what they are told. Several ex employees will tell the truth about Jenny and the way she treats people. She has lost my business, and that of my son and his 4 dogs. If that mattered to her she would have never treated me like she did. 😐 She's not the only doggie day care, boarder or groomer around here!

name: Kate Pickard
text: I have a very social Australian Shepherd, and I have never seen her so scared of anything. I took my dog there for a few stays around a year ago.  Her first "daycare" went awesome. They gave me a report card for her and she was happy and seemed to have gotten good exercise. I had pre-paid for a few visits because it was cheaper. Well, after her second visit there, I notice dried pee and poop all over her. They said that dog just pee in their runs and it is normal, but my dog is very house trained and would only pee in her run if she wasn't let out for the 8 hours she was there. Then, for her third visit she was shaking and WOULD NOT go in the doors. She was crying and scared and they took her by the leash and drug her in the back. I picked her up that night and she was crying and then she went out to pee and was trying and it was DARK yellow and very concentrated, like she had not gotten water all day. Whats weird is that after I stopped taking her there, maybe a few months later, they posted a video of her "barking," for national dog day. But that is her nervous bark and whines, not sure why they were more than happy to film her scared and crying. My only suggestion is if you have a dog that is active and likes people, maybe look for another place.

name: melinda peck
text: Love Pet Palace! Our neighbor recommended when we got a new lab puppy. She goes almost every day and can’t wait to get her collar on before we get in the car. We have been very happy with staff and care of our little girl!

name: Donny James
text: Everyone knows my dog when I drop him off and he bolts out of my truck trying to get inside. All I have to do is ask if he wants to go play with his friends and he goes crazy. He’s very slobbery, so I do the once a week bath they offer . I wish they were open past 6 so that I didn’t have to rush after work, but other than that I’m very happy with the place.

name: wayne dodd
text: Boarded my two Jack Russells last week. My cousin worked there a year ago and liked it, so I took my dogs there even though I usually don’t board them. The building was clean, I took a tour and was surprised how big the place is. Would definitely recommend and we’ll be back.

name: Kate Banta
text: I took in two matted Bernese Mountain dogs, a breed that doesn’t typically have an extensive cut when being groomed. The staff took such wonderful care of them and even though they had to be shaved down to the skin behind their ears and in a few other spots, you couldn’t tell one bit. They were so pretty when I picked them up!! Such a clean, welcoming place, and the prices cannot be beat for the level of care and service. I drove an hour to Auburn from my home near Columbus on a recommendation, and I’m so glad I did. I will continue to use Pet Palace regularly!

name: Joeretta Smith
text: My dog was a weekly bath client. The staff NEVER cleaned his eyes nor made sure that he was completely dry. His eyes were so bad after the last bath that the groomer had to literally cut most of his hair from around his eyes. I am SO disappointed at the service. I was warned not to go there but I thought that I would give them a try despite the warnings. NEVER again!!!!

name: Maureen Chase
text: I boarded my two dogs recently at Pet palace. I was very surprised how nice the place was for a kennel, and my dogs came home smelling great! They got a cute little report card from play group, too. My neighbors have used them for many years and they talk about how much they love Pet palace all of the time so I thought I'd give them a try. Glad I did. We'll be back!!!

name: Sophie Tullier
text: Staff is always friendly and upbeat when I bring my two dogs in. They always come home fresh and clean. We are very pleased with the time my pups spend at Pet Palace. Affordable, too!

name: Emily Waller
text:
*UPDATE* (at bottom)
I boarded my dog here (Pet Palace Inc. Auburn AL) this past weekend (06/14/18-06/17/18) for 3 nights and four days, including doggie day camp. WOULD NOT recommend, 0/10. First, they are so busy and understaffed it seems that they don't even take the time to relay any extra charges or changes in charges, they really want to sneak in those extra ridiculous fees. Second, they did not make time for me when I called for an update and were very short and even hung up on me before I was done. Thirdly and MOST IMPORTANTLY my dog came back to me INJURED. She had two symmetrical injuries on the side of her mouth. That they claim to have no knowledge of. They tried to blame my dog and then tried to say I don't know my own dog. It isn't an injury she could really give herself. They claim to have no knowledge of it or not have noticed it but I took her to veterinarian and they said it would have been bleeding and the bleeding on top of the noticeable swelling injuries on her lips would have been very hard to miss. So either they are lying, or they paid absolutely zero attention or care to her. Now she has to be on antibiotics as well as being in pain because of these people and their negligence. I will never come here again and I suggest to anyone who actually loves their pet, not to come here.

*UPDATE*: The manager at Pet Palace called my personal phone number that I had left as my contact number while my dog was staying there, to complain about the honest review I had left of my personal experience. They did refund me for the extra treat charges that were not displayed visually or verbally (they had charged me to give my dog her own treats that I had provided for her and made no mention of it when I told them). They felt that this small action of doing the right thing meant that everything else was fine. She claimed that I was putting false accusations out there. As mentioned above, a licensed vet had told me that the injury would have been bleeding (on her and other things) and swelling (she has white fur, blood and a swollen lip injury like that would definitely be noticeable if you are actually doing your job taking care of the dogs). When I claimed I could not talk because of work and had to go the manager did not want to take no for an answer and continued to try and argue with me about my review being "wrong". This is extremely unprofessional of a business to call and complain to a customer for leaving their honest and personal experience online for others to see.

name: LeejaClane
text: My 8 month old never met a stranger, but she's very quick to indicate when she is it is not happy to be somewhere. After her first day camp, I took her back a week later and as soon as she saw where we were through the window, she was overjoyed and whining to hurry up and get out. That's the highest praise in my opinion. The staff are friendly and professional, and you even get a report card when you pick them up that says how they did that day, both in socialization and whether they drank, slept, had fleas, and went to the bathroom outside for them. I highly recommend them!

name: Will Carol
text: My dogs love this place. We can't say "Pet Palace" at the house without the them getting excited and running to the door. The staff is really friendly and the place is always very clean. We've used them for boarding and baths, and our dogs go to play camp there a few times a week.

name: Jamie Burnett
text: Our sweet Petey Puppy loved this place!  All you had to say was "Pet Palace" and he was at the door waiting to get in the car!  He would run straight to their front door and bark at the person behind the counter until they took him back.  He went 1-2 times a week for day camp, he was groomed there and he was boarded there when we were unable to travel with him.  He required seizure medicines 2-3 times daily and they administered all his medications.  The girls that work there keep in touch as well as the owner and are like family to us because they loved our dog and gave him great care while he was there.  As with all businesses there's always something once in a blue moon that isn't quite perfect, and if we ever brought up anything, like he had a wet tummy one time after camp, obviously not their fault, as our dog LOVED water and probably dumped his bowl, but they apologized and dried him off right away so that he didn't get the car all wet.  They could have just brought us a towel, but they blow dried him so he was nice and dry.  Taking care of something like that makes me respect the business even more when they handle issues with a smile and make sure you are satisfied.  They truly went above and beyond, and when a business goes above and beyond like Pet Palace and they they have great customer service you can't go wrong.  Thank you Pet Palace and Jenny, Taylor, Marlie, Ciera and all the staff for being there when we needed you!

name: Kay McClain
text: I cannot say enough great things about Pet Palace. My dog LOVES it there! From playtime to special treats to special attention!  He is really picky about his friends and he loves it here!

name: Marissa Christin
text: We have left our dog here a few times once for a week period and twice for a weekend. The weekend experiences we didnt notice anything wrong with spunky and happy dog. This last time we left him for a week (07/22/19-07/28/2019) We noticed something wasnt right, he wasnt active as he normally was and all he has done is stayed in the same place, he had been limping or more so walking on the tips of his paws. My husband were hoping he shake whatever off so we gave it two days. Today (7/31/19) ended up having to taking him to the emergency vet, he seems to be extremely dehydrated, will not eat, is constantly shaking as if he is scared and is having a hard time getting on and off the couch or up the stairs. I left him at the vet and will give an update when i go back. But at the end of the day, we will NOT be leaving our dog here again!

name: r williams
text: I’ve been going to pet palace for 12 years, and my dog loves it there.

name: Emily Runion
text: I used to work at Pet Palace and if I could give this facility a negative star I would. The management is TERRIBLE and the manager screams at dogs and employees. There's not enough help to keep up with all of the boarders and doggy day campers and the ratings speak for themselves. I would never board my own animal here because I know it would not be treated well and they allow aggressive dogs to board as well. I was attacked by a dog nobody can handle and the manager refused to tell the owner the extent of my injuries. She tried to convince me that he was "playing". So no, this facility needs to be investigated and I would NEVER recommend boarding your pets there.

name: Kat Jarboe
text: When we arrived with our dog about a week ago for day care services, the very young girl working at the front desk was quite rude and unprofessional. She clearly did not have enough experience or maturity to understand how to handle herself in the role she was in on a busy day. I would not recommend this place because they seemed grossly understaffed, which presents issues with being able to provide proper pet care.

name: Madeline Choi
text: I boarded my animals here for spring break, and I also paid for my dog to get a bath before I picked them up. I picked up my animals and my dog walked out with urine stains all over her, including her chin -- which means that she was LAYING in her urine the entire time! I asked the employees what this was, and they said exactly: "Oh, another customer asked about that earlier. It's just our kennels." I took it as the truth and put my animals in my car. My dog smelled like urine ALL OVER -- I had to take her to PETCO immediately after so that they could bathe her properly. Also, my dog is EXHAUSTED and I left a bag of food for her to have for the week. It weighed the same when I picked her up, so they obviously did not feed her the food I asked them to feed her or they did not feed her at all. The employees don't care either. Don't waste your time or money.

name: Chardie1594
text: I am so disappointed at the service I received during the drop off for my two pets. I stopped in 2 days prior to drop off to inquire about my pets as well as fill out paper working I was greeted by one of the workers who was so rude to me. The following day I called again and whomever answered the phone was rude again, I'm assuming it was the same person from the day before, she left me on hold then hung up. On drop off day she was even more rude than the first time. In conclusion, I will NEVER leave my beloved pets there ever again. They are unprofessional and inconsiderate! In light of everyones rudeness, thank you Christian for your great service!

name: JR
text: Went a few months ago to get my dog groomed. She loves spa days but she was not herself when I tried to drop her off. This was her second time going here and she was not happy. She was  shaking  in the car and would not jump out. She started to whine when I left her making me very suspicious of what happened during her first trip. I have never seen my dog run to me faster when picking her up. I am so hurt as a pet owner and will never let my dog or my friends dog go to this place . They are obviously doing something to make my dog nervious.

name: Maya Branch
text: I was weary about this place from the bad reviews but i gave it a shot anyway. The first few times were okay until I picked my dog up and realized she had urine and dried poop on her. I addressed it with the staff and they made sure it didn’t happen again. Then I go to drop my dog off 11/11 and got attitude from the “manager”. Before we walked fully inside, she had an attitude and asked why was my dog there. No greeting, said it with an attitude and put her head back down to whatever she was doing. I preceded to ask if her day was going well and noticed my dog pooping. I tried to pull her out and she stopped. I apologized and asked the young lady for a bag and paper towels and she snaps at me to take my dog out. Which my dog had already finished bc it wasn’t much. She proceeds to mumble under her breath as she walked to the back to get paper towels and when she got back to the front, so I asked if she had an attitude and she says, “well I mean your dog just pooped and you need to take her out” and I said she stopped by the time I pulled her. That doesn’t give you the right to get an attitude with the customer which she had an attitude when we walked in. Not sure why as the staff loves my dog. Not sure if she was having a bad day but they just opened 15 minutes prior. Either way I will not be taking my dog back. You work with dogs all day so dog poop shouldn’t be a surprise. If you can’t handle that and good customer service then you need a new job...

name: Kellie Sellers
text: Probably talking about the same young girl at the front desk as everyone else, but both times I’ve taken my dog to this place, I’ve been met by an incredibly rude and inconsiderate girl at the front who acts like you are wasting her time and energy. They might should just work on their attitudes a little more and they might have more customers. Will never walk into this place again.

name: Mallie Taylor
text: Our dog was terrified to go here. He normally loves any type of animal daycare, so it was extremely unlike him to be so anxious. After reading the other reviews, it confirms my fears that he was not treated with kindness here. We won't be returning.

name: Forest Dewberry
text: $30/night

name: Lindsey Siggers
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR PETS HERE ! I have never in my life been so disrespected by a manger of a business and I will not ever bring my dog back there. The manager was very unprofessional and yelled at me and my sister when trying to pick up my dog. That manager should be fired.

name: Cynthia Ross
text: I picked my baby girl up after 3 nights at Pet Palace around 10:30 am.  There was only about 1/8th of her food gone which surprised me. She also came from behind the counter acting totally not like herself.  She whined all the way home and the minute I let her out of the car she stinkied and pee peed. (always does both first thing in the morning)  When I let her in the house, she immediately went to the water bowl and guzzled down lots of water like she hadn't had any in a long time..  Both of these are totally not normal behavior for her.  The "best" part is, I picked her up on a Saturday morning around 10:30 and by Sunday evening she was coughing and sneezing.  Her vet said she picked up a respiratory bug from another dog and she needed 2 prescriptions that she had to take for 10 days.  (She wasn't around ANY other pets except the Pet Palace pets.)  I will NEVER use Pet Palace again!!!  Not only are they extremely expensive but they do not have good clean places for 4 legged babies to stay healthy.

name: Gracie Breitenfeld
text: The staff was really rude. They wouldn’t show me where my cat would be sleeping. When I picked him up he was so traumatized he started shedding mass amounts of fur and was in a terrible mood for days. I don’t know what they did to him but I’m never allowing him to stay there again. Over priced, with unaccomodating staff.

name: Hannah Anderson
text: Took our 1 year old dog for day care. When we picked her up, she was covered in poop. Thought maybe it was a fluke. Took her a second day & she was terrified to get out of the car. Then when I picked her up, she was again covered in poop!!!!!! She wasn't even there an entire day and somehow gets covered in poo and they don't even have the decency to clean her up.

name: Taum Hanlon
text: My dog *loves this place.

name: Michael B
text:
I went here looking for a place to take my dog for an occasional daycare. When I went to check out the facility, the staff was short with me and quite rude. I also asked if I could tour the facility to see what they had to offer and they said they would only let me see it during a couple of specific hours (pretty inconvenient ones) and that an appointment was also required during those times. It gave me a very uncomfortable feeling about the place. I figured they would be proud of their facility, but instead I thought "what do they have to hide that they can only let people see their facility a couple of times a week?" I left, went to another facility in town, and that facilities staff was very nice, honest and transparent. Although Pet Place has better pictures online, I would rather deal with more pleasant and transparent people, and just know I can check in and see what is going on with my dog at any time. I have never gone back to Pet Place, and I have never looked back.
tl;dr: Rude staff and sketchy policies.

name: Ray Wilson
text: We use to board here all the time until one of my dogs came home injured and the other acts like he had been hit. Seems to be ran by a bunch of teenagers or young college kids with no real adult supervision. We stoped boarding here over a year ago.

name: Blake Potts
text: I have boarded our two dogs twice at Pet Palace, and twice they were soaked with urine when I picked them up. If you love the idea of your pets sleeping in their own urine then this is the place for you.

name: Makenzie Bray
text: Very clean and nice!

name: Joelle LeRoy
text: I’m a former employee and I would NEVER bring my own pets here . Unsanitary and hostile environment.

name: Anonymous Reviewer
text: I used to work here.

name: Cari Parker
text: Shady loves the Palace!!!💘💘💘

name: Bruno Ulrich
text: Staff is very professional and courteous in every way.  Facilities are immaculate and care is exceptional.  In Inn offers an App so that clients can monitor their pets.  Only problem is getting it to work.  After not being able to get the App working the first year, I asked staff to assist me in getting it operational this year.  Staff person did not know how to operate it.  After attempting unsuccessful to get it to work, I asked two tech savoy persons to assist me in getting it operational; neither was successful.  Upon return from vacation, I asked to speak to the Manager.  Customer service is definitely NOT her strong point.  She got the App to work, I said two tech savoy person had tried to get it to work.  She got it to work and commented several times that she had gotten it to work and simply didn't understand our problem.  I asked her to show me how to operate it and she implied repeatedly it was our ineptness that was the problem.  I'm hopeful that the Manager will  train staff so to be able to assist customers in getting the App working before leaving the Inn.

resp.text: We are sorry for the camera issues you had. We have a software that sometimes is hard to install. We are more use to Apple phone than droids and droids are sometimes harder to install and work with. There was an update that installed the software with an option we normally don’t see as default on your phone. We have notified the front desk and staff of the new default option and hopefully in the future they will all be able to help. Cameras are not always a given just due to us not having technical staff on site. We have a consultant that installed the software for use and can help occasionally.

name: adam johnson
text: I've always had good experiences boarding my dogs here. They keep everything clean and are friendly. They also will wash and dry them before you pick them up which is a nice touch. You can also see your pups on their app depending on the room you book.

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to take care of your fur baby. We appreciate you taking the time for this great review.

name: Phyllis Brown
text: They took excellent care of my senior dog while I was out of town.  Very good experience!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to do this review. We appreciate you and your fur baby. And thank you for allowing us to take care of your fur baby.

name: Taylor Janousek
text: My family has had their pets groomed here and they had done a fantastic job. After rescuing my pup I decided I would give them a try. There is an extensive application process where you write your dogs issues and I said that my dog was scared of men. After dropping him off I shortly got a call back saying he was ready but they were not able to cut his nails due to him being reactive and aggressive. When I arrived I asked if a man had tried to cut his nails and they said yes. I told them in the application that he was scared of men and would not be okay with that. They then went back inside and said a female also tried to help but he became reactive. I checked the nails they did cut and I understand now why my dog was reactive, his second nail was cut way too short and was damaged. I have seen this worked be very rough with some of the other dogs. I know they have some great groomers, just read the application for the dogs triggers!

resp.text: We are so sorry you were not happy. Please give us a call so we can discuss any issues.

name: Caitlyn Smith
text:
I have taken my yorkie here several times to be groomed. I tell them to trim up his face and give him a clean and cut look. I tell them exactly what I like with his hair a little bit longer and his face to look neat, and every time I get him back he has been shaved or does not look like he's been groomed at all. I have given them several chances and still the same result. I said something to the employees last time he was there and a woman I believe was a manager or owner was very rude and unfriendly.

Maybe okay for boarding, but I do not recommend for grooming.

resp.text: Your last appointment was November 2020. We are sorry you were not happy with your grooms and it was not brought to our attention. We try to do what the customer likes on their dog but sometimes it is just not possible due to the coat. Our senior groomer did your puppy the last few times and she has over 20 years experience grooming. Again we are sorry you were not pleased.

name: anna
text: Grove Bark Inn is the ONLY place I trust with my two year old Golden Retriever. They are courteous, take good care of him every time he visits, and always reliable. I completely recommend this local business to anyone in Auburn. I personally recommend the groomer Kathryn- she has done an amazing job with Jax over the past year!

resp.text: Thank you so much for this review.

name: Bobby Burks
text: Been going here for a couple of years and haven't been disappointed yet. The staff treat my dogs like they are their.👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to take care of your fur babies. We appreciate the review.

name: Mallory Mitchell
text: I was very afraid to board and groom my 6 month old puppy, but Grove Bark Inn was friendly and very professional which made my decision easy on where to send him for a couple of days!! My pup had so much fun and received top notch care while he was there. The staff answered every phone call, email, and question I could think of in a timely and very respectful manner. Very reasonable cost. I live in Birmingham, but will take him to Auburn just to get him boarded here next time!!

resp.text: Thank you

name: Olivia Christopher
text: Grove bark inn did a great job with my dog. Everyone was very professional and I will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you so much for this review.

name: Logan Grant
text: They do a decent enough job with our dog, but you can never get in touch with them. I have tried to call for weeks about grooming and they have not answered the phone once.

resp.text: We are so sorry you were unable to reach us. We did have a part of time there were phone issues that we were unaware of til recently. Feel free to also email at grovebarkinn@gmail.com

name: Lauren B
text: I've used Grove Bark Inn for boarding my 2 year old lab Boone and was thrilled with the service here. The facility in clean and the rooms are large and comfortable. He enjoyed the day camp and had a great time during his stay! I love that they have the 24 hour webcams so that you can keep up with what your dog is up to! Would recommend this place to anyone I know!

name: Meg Mayfield
text: I cannot express the professionalism, courteous attitudes and wonderful environment provided at the GBI!!! As a past vet tech, & phlebotomist, with my bachelor's from Auburn in design- I have NEVER seen a cleaner or better facility/staff. Treat yourself to peace of mind and treat your pup to the very best at Grove Bark Inn!

name: Cameron Ward
text: My dog starts to shake with excitement at the stop light before we get to Grove Bark Inn, and can HARDLY wait for them to take him back to play! He is  VERY high energy, but comes home exhausted from day camp. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and allowed Nova to play in large dog camp because they noticed he had too much energy for medium dog camp. They really get to know your dog and the report cards are always thorough and specific. We love GBI!

name: jamie donahue
text: My dog Rhett LOVES Grove Bark Inn! He comes home from daycare totally exhausted from playing with his friends all day. The report cards at the end of each day are so thorough and really give you a glimpse into the fun your dog has during the day. Friendly staff and a very clean facility! 10/10 bring your pup there for a day of fun!

name: Thomas Carlisle
text: Very nice place to board your pup! New facility, outdoor play area and friendly staff! Highly recommend!

name: Terri Holt
text:
First off, Lexie, who I made my reservation with was super on the phone!  However, I made a reservation in August for an October 31st- November 3rd stay.  (2 months in advance!).  We drove from Montana to Alabama.   When we arrived, our dog was not placed in the the kennel I originally requested.   The facility now was full, and they could not/would not accommodate us.  I spent MANY phone calls trying to get my dog in a better space there.  He was in a kennel without access to an outdoor run, which is what I originally requested & it was not great for my dog.   They did move him on the second day, in the afternoon, to a kennel with a run, only to move him back the next morning to a non-outdoor kennel.  We ended up picking him up on November 2nd instead of the 3rd.  When we paid our bill there was a $20 transfer fee for the kennel with the run!!  Which, in my opinion, was not the right thing to do.  Mind you, it’s NOT about the money,$20 is nothing!  It’s about customer service.  I corresponded with the owner with nothing positive as a result.   Perhaps, she feels we live 2400 miles from there and won’t be a repeat client.   We’ll be back, with our dog to visit family & I will do my research.  I will not board here again!
I do not board my dog often; next time I do, I will better check out the facility.  Things I will look for are:
1. A kennel with access to the outside.
2.  An owner who will own a problem, if one occurs, rather than say one of her employees made a mistake.
2. An outside play area.  (The play area here was an indoor room, that in my opinion was way to small to accommodate the number of dogs they had in it.  I was able to view it via a camera.  When my dog was in there I counted 11dogs!! AND, you have to pay extra for this, “Day Camp”.  Again not about the $, just charge more and make it available to all & make it a suitable, fun outside area.  People like me who love their dogs, will GLADLY pay for the happiness of their pet.  BTW, the “Day Camp” is not offered on Saturday or Sunday!!!!
Guess dogs don’t need exercise/socialization
on weekends! (?)

name: Amy Cotney
text: Love this place! My CAVALIER loves this place! Great service. Clean as a whistle. 5 star ALL the way!

name: Jai Symone
text:
Unfortunately I am not able to give a review on the services but I called to inquire about a job for Pet Care Specialist that was posted 3 days ago. The person I spoke with did not care to give a name, was very short and unhelpful. I asked if the position was still available to which she responded, “I have no idea”. I then asked if I could speak with a supervisor and she stated there was not one in at the time. Understanding that they had just opened, I figured they would come in later so I asked if she knew when a supervisor would be. She then replied with “uhm, I have no idea”.
I have worked in a veterinary specialty hospital and I have never once seen or heard of anything like this. It is not only rude but very unprofessional. I thoroughly enjoy working with animals and the connections I build with pet parents. This small ordeal (big in eyes for clients) has upset me so much that I would not ever bring me fur child here or desire to work here. I hope that this review is taken into account and changes are made to ensure clients and their fur children are met with the upmost professionalism.

name: Joe Szem
text: Called this place a week ago and made a reservation for 2 weeks for 2 of my german shepherds. Here I am the afternoon before I am to leave for christmas vacation and they are saying that they don't have a reservation for us. At the time of making the reservation, they said they had two runs left, and today they are saying they have been booked for a month. now I'm in a bind and scrambling to find a place for my dog the evening before we leave. Would never use this company.

name: Susan Crain
text: I love this place. You can tell they truly love animals!

name: Leslie Moore
text: They do a wonderful job grooming our babies

name: Robert Grantham
text: One of the best staff and the best place to board your baby and have them groomed.

name: Lizetta Burks
text: Best grooming service in Auburn

resp.text: Thank you

name: Devin Gibson
text: Great place locally owned and operated

name: Joey Smallwood
text: Great place

name: Sara Byrd
text: This vet clinic and it’s staff are outstanding in every way. Seriously, if I could even begin to convey their kindness, excellence, affordability and professionalism in one paragraph, EVERYONE would be using them. The facility is super clean, great atmosphere and you never have to wait long to be seen. The kindness from the staff is like medicine for your soul, makes you want to go out and do good deeds and be happy! I leave there every time feeling equally as satisfied and happy as I do when I leave church. I know my fur babies are in the hands of some amazing people! The level of care and compassion is worth it, believe me!

name: Jacqueline
text: The staff is wonderful here! And Dr. Mahan is the most kind and caring veterinarian I have ever met! I have been bringing my fur babies here for many years!!

name: Dora Mahaffey
text: New to area with a sick dog and was pleasantly surprised by the rapid appointment.  The care and attention to detail was wonderful. EVERY person I encountered over the three days was friendly, helpful and professional. Definitely will use their services again.

name: Chaplain Marcus Allison
text: I am so thankful for the kindness that was shown to me and my beautiful cat, my little man, Jerry Christian from Dr. Dixie and all the staff. Although Jerry couldn't get better and had to leave for heaven Dr. Dixie was so compassionate to us it really helped. They also sent a wonderful card that means so much .

name: Adam Graham
text: I have been using Westside for over 10 years.  They are always very helpful and will get what you need done to your animals.  If you have a problem with a pet I suggest you bring them here.  Very friendly staff,  great with animals.  I have a rednose pitbull named Star!  They treat her so well when she comes if like she doesn't want to leave,  so trust me when I say they know what they are doing here.  They do almost all animals from dogs, cats, cows, horse, and many more so if you are looking for a great animal doctor.. please visit them and tell them that you were referred by Adam Graham.  Thank you for taking the time to read my article

name: Cassandra Gibbs
text: This is hands down the best vet in town!  They truly love and care about every single animal that comes into the place!  They are always friendly and professional.  When my dog had cancer they went beyond my expectations and treated him like he was part of the family joining in on the fight.  Zorro didn’t make it but he lived longer than he would have thanks to these good people!  I have always and will forever use this vet for all my animals ❤️

name: T.roy
text: Great service, friendly staff, we've taken both our dogs and horses here.

name: Jason Morris
text: Great customer service extremely nice employees

name: Danielle M
text: Just moved from FL to Arab and was lucky enough to be referred to this animal hospital! Our dog suffered 3 seizures out of nowhere last night and they got us in first thing this morning for care! Pleasurable experience from the very beginning starting with the lovely lady, Angel answering my phone call, so caring and efficient   in helping us get my dog in ASAP. Due to Covid19 their lobby is still closed, but immediately on my arrival I called and someone came out to greet us and bring us in the side door to avoid traffic. Dr. Lauren Ellenburg came into the room quickly and already had briefed herself with the information about my dog’s blood work from another hospital the night before. She is so compassionate, knowledgeable, and thorough with explaining what she feels needs to be done for your animal. She listens to you and doesn’t make you feel rushed! You can tell she genuinely loves her career and cares for the animals! Amazing is all I can say. She and her whole staff 5 ⭐️. Dr. Lauren Ellenburg answered my million questions and personally got on the phone to update me on my dog’s treatment. They don’t do any procedure without talking to you first and getting your approval and they’re so affordable (not like FL). She is so reassuring and sweet. We will be returning here for sure and highly recommend this animal hospital! Thank you all so much for treating our Oliver.

name: Kat Lopez
text: Thank You for always taking such good care of my babies! Y’all are just simply amazing!! Trouble Dery says Thank You!!!!

name: OTG 76
text: Wonderful open house yesterday excellent staff . The only place I take my kids aka pets!!

name: Barron Latta
text: I had a stray cat that showed up at my house so I started feeding him. After I saw that he decided to make a home at my house I took him to Westside to have him neutered and to get all of his shots and anything else that he might need. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I can't remember the attending vets name but he was great. The price for all they did was very reasonable. My cat looks and feels so much better. I am very happy with their service and will be returning as needed.

name: Kimberly Ferris
text: Dr Mahan is a wonderful vet to all of our dogs. She has helped us with many foster dogs also. We have been going there for almost almost 19 yrs.  Wouldn't think of going anywhere else.

name: Amber Rigsby
text: We love Westside! This is the only Veterinary office we will ever use. Our main Veterinarian is Dr. Mahan and I cannot say enough about how amazing she has always been. Yesterday I ended up having to take our cat up there unplanned. We saw Dr. Wilks & I couldn't be more pleased. He was so amazing, took his time, interacted with our cat and made sure to thoroughly go over everything. I would definitely recommend them every time!

name: Amber Wilson
text: Used this vet for all my animals. Set up payment arrangements and have paid it off several times. Even paid a bill for an animal that wasn't mine. Staff acts like I've never paid bill. What I don't understand is why the staff is acting in this manner.

name: Peggy Ashburn
text: They have been our veterinarians for over 25 years.  All of our pets have received excellent care from everyone there.  I would not dream of going anywhere else! We have also boarded our pets there several times and they are cared for just like members of the family.  They are simply Top Notch!!

name: Billie Ellen Simpson
text: This has been my vet service provider since 1999. Everyone connected to this hospital is dedicated to the care of both the pet and its owner. They are professional,compassionate,understanding and always willing to work with you to achieve the best level of care possible for your pet. I wouldn't go any where else. In my opinion they are the best in the area.

name: Gary Ferris
text: We love veterinarian Dixie Mahan. She has always gone over and above for our various dogs and cat. She is patient and willing to discuss all options and answer in detail any questions that we have. And the prices are much more reasonable than in Huntsville to which we live closer.

name: Sandy McDonald
text: We've been using Westside Vet for over 20 years, wouldn't use anyone else. It doesn't matter to us which doctor we see, because they are all so friendly, caring and patient with our animals, and don't leave us until all our questions are answered. We've boarded our dogs there a few times and never worry about them, we know they are taken care of and loved.

name: stevenjsmith
text: Multiple visits I realized they add certain things to your bill without asking the customer . For example I took my cat and four kittens up there for shots and told them that is all I wanted and they charged me for a feline leukemia test and told me they do it for all adult felines. After calling and asking why they did it the female over the phone hung up on me. This I not the only time they have added charges to my bill. I don't think all the people leaving these reviews are actually looking at their invoice afterwards.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Smith, we are certainly very sorry that you were unhappy with your visit. On Thursday, you dropped your cat off to be spayed and requested that she receive all vaccinations recommended for an outdoor cat. We spayed her and gave her a rabies vaccine, feline distemper vaccine, and feline leukemia vaccine. We did not test her for feline leukemia. It is not our office policy to test all adult cats. A feline leukemia test is $50. If you check your invoice, I think you will find that this procedure was not done. We make every effort to ensure that we follow the client's requests to the best of our ability. On Friday, your wife brought in 4 kittens for their first vaccinations and deworming. They each received a thorough physical exam, their first feline distemper vaccine, and a dose of dewormer. A 20% discount was applied to the vaccinations because you have 4 kittens. Your wife paid the entire bill at checkout. Angel was the receptionist that you spoke with on Thursday when you dropped off your cat for surgery as well as who you spoke to on the phone when you called back with concerns over the bill. Angel is one of our lead receptionists and does her very best to ensure that all of our clients are happy and their needs are met. Prior to this visit, you had not been in our office since 2016. Again, we are very sorry for any confusion and we wish you the best in finding future veterinary care. Sincerely, Dr. Lauren Ellenburg

name: Kileigh Bagwell
text: The best vet in town! The renovations are beautiful inside and out. Dr. Tom Ellenburg is very informative and caring.

name: joanna deatley
text: I absolutely love this clinic. I have used many vet clinics in the past but will never go anywhere else now. I have decided that even if I move I will still use this clinic. Dr. Mahan is phenomenal with my cats and remembers every detail about them each visit.  She always calls after visits and ensures that they're both doing well and to check if I need anything else for them.  The staff always remembers me when I come in for medication refills, to board the cats, or call with a question. I love the remodel and nee facilites now as well.

name: Joy Garner
text: I don't even now where to begin saying all I have experienced at this Vet hospital. ALL the staff and Vets are excellent! They have performed impossible surgeries on some of my animals that saved their lives. A local vet in the town I live in, performed a routine spay on my pet. The nightmare began. Her intestines ALL fell out on the floor. Westside performed emergency surgery and saved her life. I totally expected and was prepared for them to tell me she did not survive. I knew I was kissing her goodbye. No vet can top this team. I drive almost an hour one way to use this facility.

name: Michael Sypniewski
text: Best treatment you can buy for your loving pets in the area. Whenever it came to serious problems, this is the vet I came to. Best staff to deal with, period. They are a little pricey, but you get what you pay for here. They have the equipment that most don't have and they will go out of the way to find the issue. I had a doberman that got very sick and was having autoimmune problems. We had an issue finding out what was wrong and her not eating or drinking was making things worse. They had to keep her for a week and I was told that the techs actually went to a grocery store to buy sandwich meats just to try to get her to eat. All of the staff here are very caring and go above and beyond to care for their patients.

name: Carolyn J Bonin
text: I am a breeder with a large number of small dogs.  I spend a fair amount of time and a great deal of money at the vet.  Over the years I have used several very good vets in the area, but I am most happy with the care, the service and the prices at Westside Veterinary Hospital.  Whether it is routine screening or an emergency C-section at 4:00am, they never let me down.  I work mostly with Dr Dixie Mahan, but I also have a high regard for Dr Andy Wilkes and Dr Jarrod Harney.  The techs and the reception staff are also first rate.  All are knowledgeable, but also willing to listen.  Prices are always fair.  Good vet care is not inexpensive, but I never feel that money is the most important issue at Westside.  Their focus is invariably on providing the very best possible care for my dogs.

name: Tammy Kelley
text: Our family has been using Westside for decades and it's always a pleasant experience.  Everyone is always so kind and helpful.  Couldn't ask for better service.

name: Jonkristjen Eubanks
text: We would not take our pets any where else.  The staff are very courteous and we have always been pleased with the service.  Large or small, you can be sure your pet will not be just another patient, the WVH staff treat each pet as it is their own.

name: Marcia B
text: Everyone from the front desk back very helpful and friendly and go out of their way to make pets and "parents" feel comfortable and welcome.  Prices are reasonable and staff outstanding.

name: Ashley Green
text: We went on a week long vacation and boarded our very anxious puppy with them. They have made his anxiety worse by kicking the kennel doors closed on him because he was getting mad, we will never use this vet's office again. He is crate trained and house broken, so he should have been fine.

name: K McIntyre
text:
Take all my pets to Westside and have for over 10 years.    They have always treated them with love and care.

I was really impressed with the young Vet Tech who asked the same questions that Dr. Wilks did when he came into the room.  I don't remember her name but you obviously are on the right path

name: cindy lindsey
text: Always  kind, great  with both of our dogs

name: Ramona Mcmurray
text: I jus love Dr. Dixie an all the staff.you need a veterinarian ,then check out Westside veterinary hospital for all your pets.you will be glad you did.

name: Terri Needham
text: Westside Veterinary Hospital has the most loving, caring and understanding staff ever!!!! They have been my Vet for all my animals for years now, and I wouldn't have it any other way!! I panicked when my nosey little Lab got a fish hook stuck in her lip in the late evening, but one call to Westside and she was in the hospital, fish hook out, and I was assured she was fine!!! No more tears and Miss Dixie took such tender care of my nosey baby and me!!!!!! I would highly recommend Westside to anyone who loves their pets and wants the best care for them!!

name: Sandy Charest
text: I wouldn't take my dogs to another place.  They are the best.  One of the vets has even met me in the middle of the night during the power outages due to the 2011 tornadoes and saved my dog's life.

name: April Jones
text: They have taken really good care of my dogs. I would recommend them. My puppy was so sick then got an allergic reaction. They worked with us until we figured out the cause and they where very patient with us.

name: Janet Ricroft
text:
We have been using Westside for fifteen years now and I would not take my dogs anywhere else.  They have the best, most caring doctors I have had the pleasure to know.

Mostly I would like to thank Dr.  Dixie Mahan for being so caring to all my animals and very understanding of their humans.
J. Ricroft

name: Aaron Sumner
text: Westside has by far the best Staff and Vets.  They love the animals that are under their care, and are very empathetic to the humans as well.  They are well worth the drive from Huntsville!

name: Benny Pendergrass
text: they will take very good care of your animals and make sure you understand what you need to do to take care of them yourself when they leave there from their carrier and I also care about your animals that's hard to find

name: Elizabeth Smith
text: Love Westside Veterinary Hospital. We have taken all our pets there for the last 30 yrs. The staff is wonderful and so very helpful. Dr. Mahan and Dr. Ellenberg have always gone above and beyond for us.

name: Thomas Reese
text:
We have been going to this vet for years after leaving Huntsville. Our family has adopted many cats and dogs that wandered in to our lives over time. They have  always treated our pets as if they were a part of  their own family. The staff even calls to check up on them days after the visit. They have fair rates and don't put your pet thru expensive tests that often aren't neccesary. They.always inform you of all the treatment options that are available and let you decide.
They seem to be busy at times and they are growing. It's a smart idea to call first but even if you don't they always get you without much wait.

name: Jacob Bittle
text: We would like to publicly  thank and applaud this vet , especially dr dixie, for their excellent car of our dog rocker. Their ability and willingness to explain the how and why was fantastic. We plan to use them for all of our future pet needs.

name: Fred Hoffman
text: Thay have been great with our cat Samantha who passed on at 21 years, and with our dog Zack currently. We highly recommend them.

name: Holly Andries
text: They have always been there to help whenever I need them.  Always professional and curious.

name: Tom Dewille
text: I have a LARGE dog, the doctor (Harris)  came out to the car to  treat him instead of making me bring him in.  The service is spectacular and very competent.   It's a 45 min drive from my house and worth it.

resp.text: Thank you, Mr. Dewille, for your kind words.  We appreciate your business!

name: David Dreitzler
text:
I have used the services of WVC for years.  They are professional and caring.  It is a great animal hospital.

Dave Dreitzler

name: andrea taylor
text: My Callie had a medical emergency on Thanksgiving Day 2016....Dr. Ellenburg met us at the office at 4pm and gave her excellent care and she is now happier and healthy!!!....The staff and Drs at this office are FANTASTIC!!

name: Poison Apple
text: Westside Vet Clinic is the best , I could not ask for better in the care of my pets , Patient , kind and loving ,Tom Ellenberg , Dr Wilks and the rest of the staff are knowledgeable and up to date on the newest medical procedures , medicine and preventive care and through in questions on medical issues , i have one pet that gets very nervous when we are called back to a room , Dr Wilks and Vet techs Rita and or Jess will take the time to calm him down and no mussel is needed , All the staff at Westside is awesome !! i will never go anywhere else !!

resp.text: Ms. Saint, thank you so much for your sweet comment! We really appreciate your business.

name: P. Lyons
text:
We love Dr. Mahan, she always returns calls at the end of the day, even if its after business hours and that means a lot to us.  The staff is friendly, clean rooms, prompt appointments.

The Lyons family, Arab.

name: Nancy Lockhart
text: Excellent care, just had two dogs spayed and they are doing great.

name: Debi Blackmon
text: Terribly expensive.  The same treatment and meds at 3 other comparable vets in the area are way more than half of what they charge.  We did not get a diagnosis/cure there either.  Just bandaids.

name: Jessica Ross
text: Westside Veterinary Hospital is the greatest vet I have ever been too, My Gizzmo got his eye knocked out by another dog and Mr Tom Ellenburg made sure we got took care of at 11:00 pm one night because all the vets around me would not see us. So now this is the only vet I use, Thank ya'll very much.

name: Liz Hardy
text: Dr. Mahan is the best veterinarian we've ever had.

name: Stephanie Mier
text: We take all of our pets to Westside Vet.  They have always taken really good care of our fur babies.  And our larger livestock too when we had them.

name: Steve Collins
text: What a great staff. They are pros all the way. Very respectfull

name: Dena Bedsole
text: Dr. Wilks is always thorough and great with my animals!

name: Beth Riley
text: In all my years of having dogs, this is the best Veterinary Clinic I have ever been to. The most knowledgeable, caring, loving doctors and staff ... they are the BEST !!

name: Dennis Buckmeir
text: Westside is the best friend Benji and Milo have.

name: Ronnie Hornsby
text: Great place to take your pet.

name: Greg S
text: They are by far the VERY BEST veterinary facility we've ever used!

name: valerie ball
text: Friendly staff, quick service, and affordable

name: Dawn Dyar (makeuplady)
text: Wonderful caring doctors.

name: Renee Eiland
text: They do it for the pet's not the money, my babies love their Dr.

name: Darlene Evans
text: Couldn't ask for better Dr's or staff, my bella luvs luvs to go up there..

name: Ellen Burdick
text: We trust them 100% with our fur babies!

name: Christina Quissek
text: This is the place you want to call… the end! We decided to make a last minute stop to see a concert at Oak Mountain Amphitheater while on an RV trip from Colorado. We were so lucky to get a hold of Stephanie at J.R.’s. She was able to accommodate all FOUR of our dogs (ranging from tall to venti) overnight on a Friday   without any hesitation. She and her coworker were extremely accommodating and attentive to our needs despite the last minute request. They even came in at 6:30am the next morning and let our dogs run in the yard for a couple of hours before we picked them up as they knew we were planning on starting our long drive back home. Thanks again ladies! (Two out of the four happy travelers)

name: BIll McClain
text: Just recently switched to JR's Pet Grooming and my Doodle has never looked better.  Goes on Saturday because of large size and that groomer rocks!

name: Mary Caitlin Rogers
text: I recommend JR’s to anyone who’s looking for a groomer! They always do a great job on my Westie!

name: Adele Allison
text: They do a wonderful job

name: Alice Seok
text: I called to ask about openings, and whoever answered the phone was very rude.

name: Terry Bresler
text: I love this place! They groom all my dogs

name: Darlene Howe
text: Great

name: Missy Wertz
text: Great place!  We got our dog when he was a little over a year old.  We then realized that he had been abused and was easily terrified.  After he was kicked out of a couple of grooming places, Stephanie took him.  She/they were patient, worked with him.  Would keep him all day if they needed to.  Now, he is a different dog.  Well behaved and he trusts them.  I highly recommend them!

name: Rachel Whitehurst
text: The staff is wonderful and the facilities are amazing! My dog, Ellie, loved spending a couple of days at day care while we were on the lake. I will definitely take her back next time we are on Lake Martin!

name: J W
text: For the past 4years "Miller " has been  blessed by Regina and staff who at Whispering Pines Pet Resort offer the BEST of pet care. NOT only does he enjoy stay overs but his weekly Wednesday day trips are a real doggy treat. In our many years of seeking quality boarding we found WPP Resort   unmatched in cleanliness and loving care. You can count on this review as an extremely satisfied customer whose pet "Miller" gets nothing but the best ! Try it out you will be Pleased.

name: Sharon Hillman
text: A wonderful place for my 2 dogs. For Regina this is not just a business this is something she loves to do. She cares and knows every dog.

name: Jah Bo
text: This is such a great place for your dogs!  Great find!

name: Janet Mitchell
text: Great place. The furbabies loved it and they were well cared for in my absence.

name: Sherry Watkins
text: This is the cleanest boarding facility around. Regina Windham will care for your furbabies as if they were her own. Size oriented playtime, obstacle course, swimming pools, multiple run areas with high fencing, air conditioned kennels each with an outdoor area, and video surveillance.

name: William Lock
text: Very nice facility. I was pleased to talk with the Regina as she evaluated our Maggie and selection with experience others that would play or be together during larger yard together time. Regina also understood keeping our dog and others healthy while visiting.  Indoor and outdoor space is available in each kennel.

name: Hunter Payne
text: Sherlock loves it!

name: Emily Marshall
text: Absolutely a dream come true for my doggos for boarding. The facility is the best I've taken my dogs to! Had no issues even with my high anxiety rescue dog (first time for her too)! My large breed and toy breed stay together in an indoor/outdoor run together and super secure. They got yard time together as well during the day and have an option to mingle with others if I wanted them to. Absolutely fantastic!

name: Charlie Davis
text: Great people and facilities...

name: William “Tennessee” Groover
text: Didn't know i was here.

name: LoonaTheFluffyCat :3
text: Hey so I have been here all day with my mom and she was very kind to the customers while the building doesn't look professional it is.. I have seen how my mother grooms the dogs but I suggest for  the owners to brush your dogs especially if they are long haired.. If your dogs fur gets matted up enough then it can be life threating I mean no offense of course its just a suggestion.. After they bathe the dogs they let them dry and groom them and then they spray them with a scent that is indeed safe for dogs.. You just need to find a good groomer :)

name: Candra Perry
text: I really recommend this grooming service. My baby Royce Lorenzo had his first trim and bath there  and she did exactly what I asked her to do. I was very happy with how everything turned out. Very laid back people with great hearts! I really look forward to bringing Royce Lorenzo and his brother Red Francis all the time. Royce was very happy and he smelled so good thanks guys☺️☺️☺️☺️

name: Tipsy Toyota
text: Absolutely lovely couple that runs this! They do great work!

name: Hollianne Craig
text: Mrs. Rhonda is the best around! Piper, Ezra, and Petey love going to get groomed! They always look and smell fantastic when I pick them up! Plus, they put cute bandanas on them when the dogs are all done! I’d recommend them to anyone looking for a good groomer!

name: Alexis Hale
text:
I took my dog here about a week or so ago and from the outside it looks great, but the second you walk in it’s completely unprofessional and messy. First, they told me that “due to covid” I would have to place my dog in this little kennel that didn’t even have a solid bottom so I’m sure it was hurting his feet. I then go over to the counter and they proceed to show me a piece of construction paper that has what looks like pieces of a rug glued on with numbers written in sharpie and there were only 4 blade length options. Most other places I’ve been show you what seems to be an endless option for lengths. I pick the one I like the best and tell them. They couldn’t give me a time because they said it depended on how easy the dogs were to groom. The price also went up if the dog was difficult to groom. I leave and get a call around 1ish saying my pup is ready. There was a sign that said they begin to charge after the first 30 minutes I believe after they call. It’s seems like they are doing anything they can to get some money. I show up and my dog is still in the kennel and I go and get him. He practically jumped into my arms, crawling up my chest.
