name: A E
text:
I have taken my dog here a few times. Not only does my dog now have kennel cough, my dog has came home now with a nip to the ear, and had a wound on the butt area. None of this was there before I took my dog here. Staff is great and professional. More likely will not be taking my dog here again.

I just want to edit to add. He doesn’t have kennel cough. He’s actually a lot more sick. He’s running a fever between 103-105.3, lethargic, no appetite, and not drinking. We’ve been to the ER vet for the fever when it got to 105.3. He’s been to his normal vet and they have no idea what’s making him so sick. We’ve been given antibiotics and his fever still won’t go down. My dog became this sick after taking him here. I don’t know if another dog they let in had something that was given to mine or maybe the food and water bowls weren’t properly cleaned. Whatever it may be is slowly killing my dog and is becoming highly expensive in vet bills trying to find out what’s going on.

resp.text:
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. Please call us at (205) 413-8164 and ask for the Resort Manager so that we can better assist you.

Thank you,

PetSuites Hoover

name: Jonathan Taylor
text:
This place is pretty annoying.  No one picks up the phone “taking care of dogs can’t answer”

Hire more people.  If you are going to act superior - be superior,  pay for a receptionist, and think about customer service

name: Erin Nelson
text: I was extremely nervous about boarding my sweet pup Lucy because the last time she was boarded she injured herself. The staff assured me that she would be well-cared for and that I would be notified of any issues and I received a tour before leaving her in their hands. She enjoyed her individual playtime and received lots of love during that time. Not only am I beyond pleased with the services provided, but I will ONLY be taking my girl to PetSuites of Hoover for future boarding needs.

name: Adrienne Samani
text:
Do not leave your dog here! I was at first very happy with pet suites and their services when they first opened. But they’ve grown so much too fast and without the proper staff to take care of your pet. They are too short staffed and are too overwhelmed, frustrated, and not communicating with one another well. I once left him for day care and asked if they could
feed my dog breakfast which they’re response was that it was a $29 fee. They didn’t feed him the entire day and would rather have him not eat for 8 hours over $29. Over the weekend that I boarded him they allowed me to pay the “gold package” when he was already approved for group play. They lied about sending photos as part of the package when I asked about it they said they had to “shift through the photos” before sending them but I never received them. When I went to go finally pick him up after receiving no word about him there was a woman in the group play area walking away from the dogs, shooing them, and yelling them to get away from her. It’s one woman and several dogs so I understand she’s overwhelmed but this is clearly a staffing issue. On a tour of the area before leaving my dog therein on the morning of our trip the cages had not been cleaned out and were dirty. I asked for a refund and they refunded me the price I paid for the gold package. I got my dog back tired and not happy. For the prices they are demanding this is the worst experience I’ve ever had at a dog boarding place. Please give time to this facility for them to find the proper amount of staff before leaving your dog here.

resp.text: Ms. Samani, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today.  I was so sorry to hear that Georgie’s experience did not live up to our usual standard of service.  We grow by hearing where our opportunities lie, and as discussed, your feedback will help us deliver the standard of care we guarantee.  I look forward to speaking with you soon to discuss the immediate improvements we’ve made to our services, and hope to see Georgie in the future.

name: Tiffany Williamson
text: The staff is awesome and the facility is great! I was having a flood emergency at my home. They took my dog in who has some anxiety and REALLY went the extra mile to make her comfortable and me as well. Very friendly and professional. I will definitely use them again and I strongly recommend them!!!!!! Ask for Carter he was awesome!!!!!

name: Donna Smith
text: I was very pleased with PetSuites Hoover grooming services.  I took my 15-year-old malti-poo to be groomed for the first time here. They took great care of my girl and she was there only 3 hours compared to an all day process.

name: Chibuike Ulasi
text: This place just opened. We toured the facility and it looks really beautiful. I believe the pets would have a great time here. We plan to send out dog in a few weeks.

name: Doretta Potts
text: I was very pleased with boarding my dog over the 4th of July.  They are very professional and nice to deal with.  I definitely would use them again.

name: Curry Bordelon
text: Friendly and helpful staff.  Clean facilities.  Our dog Ollie loves going.

name: Jim Schillinger
text: The staff here is amazing and facilities are new and clean! Our dogs love it!

name: Terry Reynolds Sr
text: Simply the best.

name: Lizzy Carstensen
text: We were very impressed with Nall Daniels and with Dr. Clark in particular. They got us in right away and were very courteous. Our dog had to have a minor procedure done and everyone was great-from the receptionist to the tech to dr. Clark calling us with multiple updates. They were so kind and you can tell they really care! They were also very open about pricing upfront so we knew exactly what to expect.

name: Karen
text: I would never trust anyone with my fur babies but Doctor Daniel's and his wonderful assistant Brandon they are the best.

name: Jennifer van Arcken
text: I can't say enough positive things about Dr. Emily Soto, who we totally credit for saving little Otter's life. After taking Otter to multiple vets when he was ill and not getting better, a friend recommended Nall Daniels. Dr. Soto accomplished emergency surgery on a Saturday that saved his life. She was very concerned not only as a vet but sincere concern for his well being. She provided very clear instructions on how to care for him during the critical days following surgery. She called and checked on him daily.  He is doing great now! Thank you!

name: Douglas Beckham
text:
My wife and I are new to the high powered world of the  “working breed” of German Shepherds.  We recently purchased one, Ramos, from  Germany.  After about  6 weeks here,  he developed a case of bloat that could have killed him.  With bloat, the stomach actually "flips over" and cuts the blood supply off to the stomach, causing a rapid distension, and death if not treated quickly.  Fortunately, Ramos' stomach flipped back without emergency surgery.

Not wanting to go through this again, we researched bloat and found the best “cure” for it is a laparoscopic assisted gastropexy.  In this procedure the dog's stomach is sutured to the abdominal wall. The sutures eventually dissolve but the stomach is held permanently in place by an "adhesion" preventing recurrent "flipping".  Many animal hospitals do not have a laparoscope or the skill to accomplish this procedure.  Dr. Daniels was able to take care of this surgery and Ramos is 99% normal after five days. He has personally checked on Ramos 4 times on his own time since surgery.

Everything about Drs. Daniels and Clark, and their clinic and team  was strictly professional, yet courteous and friendly.  We can't forget Cassidy, the glue and the center of their clinic.  Exceptional personality and warmth!

If you are looking for a superior team to take care of your special “family member”, consider Dr. Daniels and Clark at Nall Daniels Animal Hospital in Homewood.

Not close enough for you? As Joe Biden would say, "Come on man!!"
This is not about closeness!!
It’s about quality !!!!!!!!!

Douglas Beckham, D.M.D.

name: Emma Pacey
text:
When I adopted my dog, the one thing the previous owner recommended is for us to take him to this office since he had been bringing him here his whole life and they "knew him really well". The first time I took him for his annual shots and a check up I asked about the small lumps on his body and they said it was nothing. 6 months ago I took him to this office to get a check up because we had some concerns. After paying hundreds of dollars for tests and x-rays, they assured me that there was nothing usual going on with my dog. This week he started getting very sick, and after a trip to a different vet, we found out he had cancer and it was very prolonged and caused other problems like anemia, kidney failure and lesions on his lungs. This kind of progression doesn't happen in 6 months. It happens over years. He had been coming here for years and they never once said anything about the cancer that was all over my dog's body and covering his organs. At this point, he was in too much pain, couldn't eat or drink, and could hardly breathe. The new vet and I decided it was best to put him down so he wouldn't be hurting anymore. After years of coming to the same office they never said anything remotely close to cancer.

There is nothing I can do for my dog anymore, but there is still something you can do for your's. DO NOT bring your animals to this office. There is no way a cancer this severe goes unnoticed for so long with an office that provides quality care. Find somewhere to take your pets that won't treat them like they treated my dog. I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.

name: Quentin Collins
text: Always super friendly staff! Prices are comparable. Dr. Clark is awesome! Highly recommended.

name: Della Clark
text: Amazing staff. Only place I'd go.

name: Ryan Halcomb
text: My dog was referred here by my primary vet for a laparoscopic liver biopsy. The staff at Nall-Daniels was outstanding. They kept me updated on every step of the process and laid out a clear plan for the next steps. I was nervous at first taking my pet for a surgery at a place I have never been, but as soon as I started talking to the staff I knew my dog was in good hands. I would definitely recommend this place!

name: Lizzy Dee
text: They were so attentive and helpful. I got my cat groomed and a collar for her to wear when given medicine and they have kept up with us.

name: Jody Poe
text: Nall Daniels Animal Hospital is great! My little dog "Molly" was so well cared for there right up until the very end. She had to be euthanized on December 22nd, and everyone at Nall Daniels was so sweet through all of this. After Molly died, I got the sweetest cards from Dr. Daniels and Dr. Dunaway as well as from other staff. They even had a beautiful plant delivered to my home in memory of Molly. Molly always got excellent medical care at Nall Daniels, and they will definitely be my vets for my new little rescue dog that I adopted. I highly recommend Nall Daniels Animal Hospital.

name: Rocky Redding
text: They are awesome people! I have been taking my Pookie dog there for about three years.

name: Leigh Misso
text: Last week my little 10lb Dachshund was bit by  a copper head twice in our yard and Nall Daniels was WONDERFUL. They immediately took him back, got an IV started to counteract the effects of the venom, and monitored him very closely. Thru lots of prayer and the amazing Veterinarians at Nall Daniels, Gus was completely healed in 24 hours!  I would recommend everyone take their pets to them!

name: wendy roberts
text: I rated this place 5 stars at first. They did surgery on my daughter's dog. He ended up dead. They kept telling her he was OK over the phone. She called THREE times. They had 3 chances to say bring him in.

name: Tom Atkins
text:
In the year or so I’ve used Nall-Daniels I found them to be competent veterinarians, but based on exam costs I had begun to wonder if their prices were high.

So when it was time to have my pug spayed, I decided to get quotes from two of the highest rated vets in Homewood. The prices I was quoted by them were very close to each other... $250 and $260.  I then called Nall-Daniels for a quote. I was very surprised to hear an amazing price of $823. When they heard me gasp over the phone they quickly added that this was a worse case estimate.  I quickly thanked them for the estimate and moved my vet account for my 3 dogs to one of the two highly rated vets that gave me more reasonable estimates.

I wondered later what was included in a worst case scenario! A Heart transplant?

name: Nicole Harris
text: The staff was very nice and professional they gladly answered every little question i had

name: Kirk Atkinson
text: I've had four dogs cared for at Nall Daniels - they do an amazing job. Very friendly and knowledgeable techs, the vets keep our dogs in peak health and boarding is very convenient and economical.

name: Corin Thompson
text:
Nall Daniels has always been good to us. I've always been wary of local vets because they all have terrible reviews and it makes a lot of places look sketch. They have been willing and able to give us quotes for treatments so that we can make the best decisions for our cats based on our income.

Our cat Bubbles was diagnosed with bone cancer. The vet did everything she could to get the right diagnosis and give us as many options as available. They could not treat her there but she offered info for treatment elsewhere. We really felt that everything had been done that could be done. I definitely recommend this place 100%

name: Lorraine Donald
text: The dog referred to by Ms. Phillips was a dog that was given up to Adopt A Golden Birmingham with a sense of urgency.   Upon arrival to the clinic the dog had to be carried in and was recumbent the whole time and clearly in medical distress.   The blood panel showed that the dog was in end stage renal failure and to complicate matters was Heart Worm positive.  The medical team at Nall Daniels immediately relayed to Adopt A Golden Bham their findings and indicated that the dog was indeed suffering.  It was their medical opinion that the dog should be euthanized.  Neither Adopt A Golden Birmingham nor Nall Daniels Animal Hospital medical team take these decisions lightly.   We are in the business of rescuing and saving dogs.  Not making this decision and watching the dog suffer was simply not an option, as much as it devastates all of us involved to terminate the life of any of our dogs.   We have the utmost respect for Dr. Daniels and his medical team and are proud to be associated with their clinic and the "above the call of duty care" they give to all the rescue dogs that they have treated for us and will continue to treat.   We are all saddened by this.  Lorraine Donald Founder, Adopt A Golden Birmingham

name: Andy West
text: Nall Daniels has the most knowledgeable staff that we have seen in Birmingham. They are also the most caring group of people you will find and will put the needs of your pet first.

name: April L. Butler
text: Great service and techs that seem passionate about the animals, our pup seemed happy to go and not anxious when we picked up, as she has at other facilities.  Although they are a bit pricier than others, it is worth it for piece of mind.

name: Erin Laney
text: Wonderful Dr and staff all the way around!

name: Susan mcgriff
text: The girls in front are so sweet.. I use Dr Daniels is a very good person,surgeon..

name: Jean Lindquist
text: The service I received at Nall-Daniel Pet Hospital far exceeded my expectations! Nall-Daniel’s provides a variety of veterinary services including well pet check ups, grooming, surgery, and prescriptions. We went there for our yearly check up and vaccinations for our two dogs; a senior Golden Retriever, and a six year old mutt. The entrance was very clean and clam. When we got called back, we were in a decent sized examination room with a vet tech, I can’t remember his name, but he was a very kind and patient young man with brown hair. He was very thorough with us; he listened to and answered all of our questions. He even provided us with a printed out quote of what all the shots, the visit, and the treatment for the ear infection that our Golden had, before performing any procedures. Then, Dr. Dunaway came in to examine them. She immediately got down in the floor and started loving on the boys. You could see her passion for animal care when she came in the room. She was very articulate and detail oriented, laying out all of the treatment options for the ear infection and recommending medication for his arthritis, too. Her bedside manner was impeccable and I felt listened to and informed as she explained everything that she was doing. We never felt rushed, even as it got near closing time. All in all, it was a wonderful experience. I had called fifteen clinic before choosing this one. The reason I chose them in the first place was because they were one of the most affordable. Sometimes, affordability comes at the expense of the quality of care, but not here. I could tell they genuinely cared about the well being of our animals, and I think that we have found a lifelong vet! I can not recommend them enough!

name: Shocklemzoa
text: My little doggie got scratched in her eye by one of our cats. When I got home her eye was puffy and irritated. I immediately too her to Nall Daniels Animal Hospital. There was a major down pour of rain as I pulled in. As I walked in I was warmly greeted and told them what happened. Within a couple of minutes they were looking at my dogs eye and found a little scratch. They gave her some medicine for pain and put some other medicine in there to make sure there wouldn't be an infection. I could see my little precious was already starting to feel better. This is a wonderful place to take your pets. They treated my little doggie like she was one of their own. They even wiped her down with towels to get the rain off as she was shivering a little. Great service. Highly recommended. Thanks NDAH!

name: Keri Cartee
text:
Last week I had to make the difficult decision to put my sweet dog of 15 years to sleep.  I had recently made Nall Daniels my vet and had only needed to bring my dog in a few times before she died.  Although the prices are not low (comparable to other vets, but all are high these days it seems!) the care she received was excellent, the staff was very friendly, and every time I brought her in I received calls to check on her in a day or two.  When I brought her in a week ago, I knew it was probably going to be time to put her down.  She was suffering and could no longer walk.  The staff at Nalls Daniel couldn't have been more kind, caring, gentle, thoughtful, and patient with me and my family.  They made the process as personal and easy as it could be made.  They took good care of my dog and of me until the end.  They were respectful of me and my wishes during this heartbreaking time.
Today I returned from a luncheon to find beautiful flowers waiting on my porch in memory of Mini from the staff at Nalls Daniel.  I am overwhelmed at their kindness.  Thank you, Nalls Daniel, for caring for my sweet furry friend... and for caring for my heart today as I've been missing her so much.  <3

name: Alex Pearlstein
text: Awesome vet. Highly recommended.

name: Robert
text: Wonderful general vetinary

name: Katy Williams
text: Top notch professionals who care about the pets that they treat!

name: Anita Gann
text: Very caring. That are wonderful with my gut babies!!!

name: Erica Phillips
text: Euthanasia is their specialty! They did so without my consent.  They gave up on my dog within a few hours ( never take your dog to this clinic) for something as simple as puppy vaccinations they may be okay doing so. #sadistic

name: Paul Cipollone
text: Great care

name: Robert Levy
text: Best vets and most caring

name: Alan Spain
text: Great friendly staff

name: M Smith
text: My dog seemed to have a great time at doggy day care. He was happy and tired when I picked him up. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and kind. The facility appears clean.

name: Matthew Mayo
text: We take our dog rascal here for grooming and daycare regularly. He’s always so happy and excited to go, and comes home tired out at the end of the day, which is quite a feat for a jack russell. The groomer always does a great job with him, and he looks (and more importantly smells) like a million bucks after. I’ve recommended JHH to all of my friends.

name: Wendy Montealegre
text:
I LOVE Just Happy Hounds.  First, the facilty is spotless.  And their stellar staff truly love these animals.  It's genuine.
I do quite a bit a rescue, and sweet Sarah Mills, Katelyn and the rest of this amazing staff have boarded several rescues. Teaching these dogs basic manners training and socialization.  This work helps ensure they will have a successful adoption later!
Just Happy Hounds not only provides excellent care for your personal dog, they do extensive community outreach, and have saved countless dogs.  I can't say enough good about them!!!

name: james meredith
text: Very nice people. Stayed late to meet me so I could drop my dog off on a sunday!!!

name: Brittany Stephens
text:
My dog began daycare at JHH at approximately 6 months old and attended at least 2-3 times per week. I always thought she enjoyed it as she seemed excited to pull up and be dropped off. At around a year old, I started noticing a lot of staff turnover at the facility. Although I should have taken heed, I did not and my dog continued to attend day care regularly. I began noticing that my dog was very timid of the staff. In particular, she was called by one of the managers/trainers and immediately backed up, tail between her legs, and laid down in a submissive position behind me. This time I took note and my dog never returned to the facility. I still have pre-paid day care days that will go unused. When I inquired about my dog’s reaction, it was explained to me by staff that my dog was regularly kept separate in a kennel in the back during the day. AND, that her “training” involved being taken into the yard, on a leash, while other dogs were allowed to approach her and she was given commands to obey. THIS RUINED MY DOG. She has dog aggression issues to this day, largely due to her extreme anxiety which I believe was engrained into her at a developmental stage while at JHH. Please do not take your dog to this facility for daycare.

Also, please note that most of the favorable reviews were posted at least a year ago. While the more recent reviews question the dogs well-being at the facility.

name: Emma Tolbert
text: Terrible! I paid $74 per night for my 2 senior-age shelties to be boarded in the “Beach House” suite while I was out of town. When they were picked up they were soaking wet and filthy, as if they had been left outside in the rain. They were also hungry, and an excess of their food was left that should not have been if instructions were followed. Definitely would not recommend if you are looking for your pets to be well taken care of!

name: Christina Fortugno
text: Just Happy Hounds needs to be your first and last look at daycare for your best friend. I moved to Birmingham a few months ago and did not know a soul. I came for graduate school with my best friend (Oliver) and the center of my world. I shopped around for daycares like my peers do for their human children. I chose Just Happy Hounds because the staff was friendly and I loved how my dog was always playing. He does not spend hours alone in a kennel like he would at home. They have far exceeded my expectation for customer service and outright exceptional care for my puppy. Oliver had a scratched cornea from playing a little hard and required surgery. I was stressed about what to do. I thought I could not take him to daycare while he recovered for surgery. He required extensive medications and needed to watched more closely in the cone of shame. The JHH team took care of Oliver post-op just as well as I would have at home. I never have to worry about my best friend while I am at work/class all day. I know he is being loved and played with as he is at home. I could not be more thankful for such incredible care of Oliver during his time of extra need. As a nurse, I am always caring for everyone else. I have been incredibly thankful to have someone help me out and give me peace of mind. Never bring your baby somewhere else! Sarah and her team are incredible. JHH is the best home away from home you can bring you furry friend to.

name: Abigail Martin
text: I have been trying to contact them for the last ten days after my dog was groomed here. I have called and emailed to no avail and have heard nothing back. I have many concerns with how well he was supervised the hours he spent here.

name: Drew Griffith
text: I took Buddy for grooming Savannah the groomer did a excellent job in grooming Buddy. Buddy smells wonderful.  He was full of matts when I dropped him off and know he is not. Savannah has done the best job of any grooming place I have ever talking buddy to

name: Kayla Rivera
text: They are wonderful with my dog. I have needed to leave before on fairly short notice and they have always been accommodating. My dog comes back happy. I will always feel comfortable leaving my dog there.

name: Anna Waters
text: I take my dog here once a week,  and he loves it. He hasn't always gotten along with other dogs, but he is so much more sociable now after a few months of weekly daycare. The staff at JHH is so nice and helpful, and I trust their judgment. Their services are also really affordable. I can't recommend them highly enough.

name: Cj Paxton
text: I have a giant breed dog ( Cane Corse  @ 160 lbs. )  Sarah and her crew have been great with him. He loves going there to play and hang out. No other place want to work with him because of his size. Wish I lived closer to them we moved and he isn't able to go now but I will have vacation soon. And he will be there for 12 days.

name: Raphael Cohen
text: Pasta and ambiance are both good. Great lunch place

name: Matthew Spivak
text: My dogs HATE getting groomed, but JHH was incredible! I could tell they genuinely cared for my boys and went the extra mile to make them feel comfortable. My dogs were in a much better mood when I picked them up compared to other places.

name: Stephanie Agee
text: It was okay I had to keep calling for the groomer, after she was reached I took my puppy in for a bath in a couple of days he was oily

name: LaBrena Friend
text: I have found out that Sarah is no longer at JHH. I will not be returning my dogs to JHH. I always knew my dogs were in the best care when Sarah was there and no longer trust that my dogs will be in good care without Sarah being there

name: mylilgigi2018 Mills
text:
Mrs Cole
Sorry you feel like this about JHH, but I can’t  imagine Sarah ever yelling at anyone her companion for what she does is above all.
The  dedication  she puts into running to JHH  is fabulous I wouldn’t put my baby anywhere else.

name: Bethany Cryder
text: Gracie loves her day care days.  I love the staff.  They treat her so wonderfully. Cannot recommend them enough.

name: Taylor Stroud
text: We have been taking our dog here for over a year now. She absolutely loves it. She gets excited whenever we ask her if she is ready "to go to daycare". They love taking care of our pup and do a great job. definitely recommend, especially those working close by at UAB and Children's

name: Terry Pribyl
text: Great service my dog loved the people. Kept my Lumpy for a day in a pinch, and didn't even charge us for the first visit.

name: Bryan Reed
text: Attended the Birmingham Bowl on the way home to Texas on a road trip.  I needed a place to keep our dog during the football game.  The folks at Just Happy Hounds were great.  My dog was actually sad to leave her newly acquainted canine friends.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

name: mark gotfryd
text: The dog returned happy but lost weight. From being active all day or under fed??. She was returned with multiple bumps... insect bites... Flea?.. Gave her bravecto. The people are very very nice and obvious dog lovers...

name: Julie King
text: Friendly staff. 1st class care for your furbaby. Easy to find. Groomer does a great job. It's easy to get an appointment and prices are comparable to other less fancy places. There's a great vibe at Just Happy Hounds and I will continue to take my little beloved furbaby there! She got a groom that was precious but not as short as I needed for her comfort due to hotspots and they didn't hesitate to fix it for free. Great place!

name: Julie King
text: They do a good job and love my nany

name: Caywood Yamnik
text: I took my dog here for a year and a half and still they did not know her name, and called her a boy almost every time. The staff has very high turnover, and there seems to be a big internal communication issue.

name: Mark Reeder
text: Great way to get the extra energy out of our puppy plus learn socialization skills. Great place for boarding as well.

name: Kelly King
text:
I would like to say I’ve been to several doggie daycares and Just Happy Hounds by far is the BEST!!!!
You can really tell they care about your baby! I have to tell you about my experience with them today. I dropped my baby off for the first time today for her boarding I
was greeted by Sarah and Josh with warm welcomes. The others staff wanted to know exactly want Annabella need during her stay food, bath how much when. I have to say JHH has it together and I can tell Sarah is there because she loves the babies. Now I can go on my trip with no worries! Thank you JHH staff for all you do.

name: Shay Hoffman
text:
Very friendly staff however the groom on my Pomeranian wasn't quite up to snuff. I took him in at the end of March 2017 for an all over trim down to 1/2" (tail included), specific attention to his ears, and a sanitary cut.
The overall cut was uneven around his face, legs, and tail - it looked chunky, spots were missed and others cut too short. The sanitary cut was what I asked for but I noticed a razor burn/cut on the inside of his leg after we got home. They did a great job on his ears which is usually a tough spot so it seems odd that the other stuff was so spotty.
This groomer just doesn't seem to have the skill for my dog's coat or their prices. We won't be going back.

name: Leah Moseley Papp
text: My dog loves coming here and the staff is great.

name: Yashna Patel
text: My dog received an injury, it was hard to contact anyone who knew about the situation and management did not cooperate or empathize. My dog suffered a large bruise and blood spot on her back left leg. I had to call several times and finally got ahold of management. They did not find out how the injury happened and I finally had to take my dog to the vet. Also, I requested nail trimming while my dog boarded and they forgot to do so. I scheduled a drop off for my dog for boarding and no one was in the office to receive her though I let them know ahead of time. I definitely do not reccommend this place.

name: Dona Bonnett
text:
"We are so pleased with Just Happy Hounds Midtown.  The dog groomer did a fabulous job on Trouble, our 11 year old rescue dog and we definitely recommend Just Happy Hounds Midtown in Birmingham for anyone needing dog grooming, boarding, dog daycare or training. This is a wonderful new dog facility and the staff is great - thanks so much for taking such good care of my baby!  Dona Bonnett-adr Business & Marketing Strategies

We have had both of our dogs groomed several times and have been very pleased each time.  The dog groomers do a great job.  They are courteous and love the pups.  Copper loves to play at doggie daycare with the other dogs while he is at Just Happy Hounds.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

name: Rachel Popwell
text: I have taken my Cocker Spaniel here for over a year now & we love it!

name: Cory Truett
text: Dog grooming did not come out well. I recommend going elsewhere.

name: Crystal Trinidad
text: Dog grooming is fairly priced and reliable

name: Anne Marie Miller
text: My pup pepper is beyond hyper!!! We do everything to wear her out! Every time she visits happy hounds she comes home tuckered out and happy!!! Forever a fan!!!!

name: Sarah Mills
text: At Just Happy Hounds they love them Like they are there own.....

name: Kyle Pérez
text: Not only do the folks at JHH really care for your pup like you would but their trainer, LaDale, is absolutely fantastic.

name: sandy lawrence
text: Horrible mangagement  fed my one year old lab a half cup of food for four days.   STAY AWAY

name: Jennifer Griffith

text: Bones, beds and biscuits is the best, most friendly and caring place to board your pet! Piper loves going to see his other family there! The staff is beyond awesome! The girls treat Piper as their own! Can’t say enough about how great this place has been to us!!

text: We LOVE Bones! My Ellie girl loves going to doggy daycare! She’s always greeted with happy, smiling faces and lots of love! The staff is excellent in easing any worries and extremely accommodating to your pup’s needs! Daycare has made a world of difference in Ellie’s separation anxiety.

resp.text: I love your Ellie! -Brandon thanks for the review we appreciate you!

name: Brenna Williams
text: The only place I leave my dog! She goes most week days for daycare and boards here anytime I’m out of town. My dog is so timid and shy, but she never hesitates to go with these girls. They obviously treat the animals with so much love. I love that I can leave my pet and feel at ease that she’s loved and taken care of, whether it’s just a few hours or for several days.

text: My dog LOVES going to Bones! Every time I go out of town I felt so guilty till I brought him here. He loves the workers. It’s like he gets his own vacation when I go out of town. name: Rochelle Price
text: I was very happy with how my Mini Golden Doodle got treated. Alisha was wonderful with  her. I asked her for daily updates  and she didn’t miss a day and it made my vacation great because I didn’t have to worry about Gabby . I will be taking her back . It’s the best place .

name: Brittaney Gooch
text: Bones, Beds and Biscuits is such a great place! They are always quick to respond to booking dates and/or any questions I may have. The environment is clean and our baby is loved on and called by name the minute we walk in the door. He’s never hesitant to go and isn’t desperate to see us when we come in the door for pick-up. So, I know he is having fun and being well taken care of. I love that they offer baths before pick-up, so he comes home smelling clean. And my favorite thing is getting to see pictures of him posted to their Facebook page while we are away. Our entire family is always anxious to see the pictures and it makes our heart happy to see him doing well. We couldn’t recommend them more!

text: The people there are great with dogs. They'll make your dogs feel like royalty. The biscuits fit my dog's taste rather than mine though.

name: Jim Fisher
text:
EDIT: This business is under new ownership so my old 1 star review (below) is no longer applicable. I do want to leave my old review in case the old owners decide to get back into business. The new owner asked that I give them another chance and I certainly will.

****OLD REVIEW*****
I've carried my dog, Stella (a very sweet Cocker Spaniel), about a half dozen times over the past 2 years.

One two of those occasions, no one was there to open the place at the appointed time. Having to wait on them while already late for a flight is not good.

Then, after using them for all that time, the last time I picked up my dog, they informed me that I was not welcomed back. Stella had evidently scratched a door jamb or otherwise did some damage to her room. What kind of place would keep dogs in a pen that can easily be damaged by dogs?

These folks majorly inconvenienced and insulted me. I wouldn't use them again if they begged.

Madix has severe separation anxiety, and has a tendency to destroy the house when left alone. That's why we are finally trying a doggy daycare, and couldn't be happier with the results! They have totally catered to his issues (anxiety, deafness, blindness, cancer, bad back), and he is so much happier! In fact, yesterday when I picked him up, he jumped into my car for the first time in probably a year. Thank you so much, Kim, for creating such a wonderful place for our fur babies.

name: Georganne Canterbury
text: The folks at Dog U have done a great job with my Welsh Corgi puppy. She boarded and trained for a week with Calvin, who did a wonderful job training her to walk on a loose leash. Before her training, she was constantly pulling me and since her training, she behaves and is a joy to walk now. Their facilities are wonderful and my dog loves to go to daycare there. I especially like the different training and daycare packages they offer. It makes this investment much more affordable. I highly recommend Dog U for any training and/or daycare needs you might have. In my opinion, they are the best in town!

resp.text: Hi, Georganne. We are thrilled to learn that you had a positive experience with us!

name: Madison Williamson
text: We have taken our dog to Dog U for over 2 years. We initially did their one week training bootcamp and have continued with weekly daycare. The staff is so kind, attentive, and willing to answer any questions! Our dog is always happy to jump in the car and go when we ask if she wants to go to daycare. Andrea, Calvin, and Nick helped train her, and they were incredible. Gabe, Abby and the other staff members are some of the kindest! Our dog loves the Dog U team and so do we!

resp.text: Hi, Madison. We are thrilled to learn that you had a positive experience with us!

text: We have taken our Akita to Dog U two different times now and our boy seems to have a good time while he is there. He comes home tired and usually a little damp. So I feel confident leaving my baby in  their care.

resp.text: Hi, Bobbi. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

text:
We Love Dog U! We adopted our dog when he was 2 years old. We brought him in right away! We started with educational daycare which was a great way for him to socialize and learn basic commands. Now, he goes to daycare to socialize and stay active.

Everyone is very professional at Dog U, which is why we keep coming back! They know Cash by name and love him like he is their own! Dog U feels like family now and we recommend them to everyone.

resp.text: Hi, Sarah. Thanks for taking the time to share your positive experience. We truly appreciate it!

The staff is very kind and always with a positive attitude,  it makes me feel good knowing that Chanel is well taking care of.

resp.text: Hi, Maria Vargas. Thanks for taking the time to share your positive experience. We truly appreciate it!

text: Please check out Dog U! My two puppies have experienced both the educational and regular daycare options; they come home tired and happy and I like the socialization they get with both humans and other dogs. The staff clearly enjoy working with dogs of all ages and sizes and it’s fun to watch the dogs waiting for their turns to be relayed inside. I recommend Dog U every opportunity I get.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Amy. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.

Cheers,

Dog U Birmingham

name: GandE2016 Thomas
text:
My family and I had bought a puppy from a breeder.  All we wanted in a dog is great behavior.  When we got our puppy, he was jumpy, mouthy, and generally a rambunctious puppy.
We sent Charlie to DogU for the 1 week undergrad training which conveniently coincided with a family vacation.  After 1 week, we got a totally different puppy — one that walks right beside us, hasn’t been mouthy and has generally great.  We haven’t even had the four follow-ups!

Thank u, DogU!

name: Heather Hinton
text: I LOVE Dog U Birmingham and so does my pup! The staff is just so friendly, helpful and accommodating - and they adore my dog (which makes my heart happy). For a few years I lived farther away and the trip to Dog U was a lot longer (with other daycares closer by) - but I chose to make the long trip every day and I would make that choice again. They are so good to me and my dog - I wouldn’t take him anywhere else!

resp.text: Hi, Heather. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

text: Our dog always comes home from DogU happy, tired, and remembering her manners. We love the socialization and training she gets there and so does she. Love DogU!

name: Monica Yontef Gaffney
text: I cannot say enough wonderful things about Dog U.... let's put it this way:  they're the opposite of everything you don't like about your current doggie socialization center.  They obviously love what they do, their staff CARES, they have an equitable business model (don't try to reneg on their clients for paid-for days simply because of an arbitrary expiration policy), they ....answer the phone!  Yes!  A live, cheerful human answers the phone when you call!  I'm so blessed to have found out about Dog U.  🥳🥳🥳

resp.text: Hi, Monica Yontef. Thank you so much for leaving us a stellar review!

name: Tamera Lea
text: We have been students at Dog U for 8 months and just signed up for another six months of continuing education.  We enjoy all the people there and my dog looses it when she realizes where we are.

resp.text: Hi, Tamera. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Amanda Rafferty
text:
We picked up our 4 month old German Shepherd puppy Wednesday afternoon only to notice that something was off about his eyes. As soon as the staff member brought him out, I could see how red and swollen his eye was. I asked if something happened and they stated no. They repeatedly acted like they could not see anything wrong with his eye until I kept insisting that it was not right (very bright red, bloodshot, swollen and bulging). He has bursted blood vessels in both of his eyes.

I still do not understand how this could happen to a dog that was in EDUCATIONAL daycare. If he is on a slip leash, he should have someone who is a trainer with him; someone who could (and should) have corrected any behavior that could have caused this to happen.

resp.text: Hi, Amanda. At Dog U Birmingham, we aim to provide positive experiences at all times. Is there anything we could do to make it better? Please call us at (205) 967-3648!

name: Maya Pace
text:
I love bringing my fur baby, Sophie, to Dog U. She has so much fun playing with the other dogs. I also get to see pictures of her on Facebook playing with other dogs, which is a big plus for me.
I told the owners that Dog U is like a Disney World for dogs 😊. I also like that I can request doggy ice cream for my fur baby during her visits.
The staff at Dog U are very courteous, friendly, and professional. I feel at ease leaving my Sophie in Dog U care. I would definitely recommend Dog U to anyone looking for a great place to bring their fur babies. I absolutely ❤️ Dog U!!!!

resp.text: Hi, Maya. Your feedback is highly appreciated. Thank you for the review!

name: Glenn Wetzel
text: We have used Dog U for Day care and are planning to use them for the week long undergraduate training. So far, they have been very friendly and professional. We look forward to working with them in the future.

resp.text: Hi, Glenn. Thanks for taking the time to share your positive experience. We truly appreciate it!

name: David Willis
text: Great trainers. My puppy has learned a great deal on a short amount of time with Dog U. Highly recommend.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, David. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.

Cheers,

Dog U Birmingham

name: ross saxon
text:
Link has done undergrad(7day boarding) and signed up for continuous learning(6 month, once a week, training day with play time). Really pays off to have the dog trained well. Friends and family are impressed with his obedience and list of commands.

This place is awesome. Link likes it and the associates are experts.

resp.text: Hi, Ross. Thank you so much for leaving us a stellar review!

name: Sharon Stuart
text: After a week at Dog U, our 17 week old puppy was responsive to basic commands and walked well on a leash. Very professional staff.

name: Shannon Powell
text:
I foster dogs. My current foster has very sensitive skin and was in need of help.  I have to give it to them. They let me drop her off and Dr. Williams call me to see what she needed. After exam I was called and given a plan of action. Then dog u gave Daisy a spa day. Nails and bath. She is much better.
I should mention they have also done dog training for another one of my fosters. Highly recommend them. You can also see photos of them on Facebook is you like that. Fun pics.

resp.text: Hi, Shannon. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Seth Miller
text: Can't say enough goods things about Dog U Birmingham.

resp.text: Hi, Seth. Thank you so much for leaving us a stellar review!

name: Beau Caviness
text: Dog U has truly treated our Pippa as family. Every day we drop her off or board her we never have to worry about her not getting enough exercise or attention. Dog U truly goes above and beyond and we cannot thank them enough!

name: Kalista Pirkle
text: I love going to dog U!!

resp.text: Hi, Kalista. Thank you so much for leaving us a stellar review!

name: Alicia Huey
text: I love Dog U !

name: Alaina Ploski
text: My two dogs love going to Dog U! Not to mention, the staff are so friendly, professional, and truly care about your dogs. The spacious outdoor play yard has something for all dogs - shade, pools, playground equipment, and toys. It is such a blessing to have Dog U close by, as I always feel at ease when my dogs are with them because I know they're having fun and being cared for.

name: morgan tucker
text: I talk to a trainer about my dog being reactive and this lady who obviously isnt a good trainer told me that cause my dog wasn’t a puppy that she was hopeless and that there isn’t anything that can be done for me her. So i left and called creative dog training which is across the street and they said she mind can be retrained it would just take awhile but it is doable .

name: Kelli Brasher
text: Absolutely love these people.  They are polite and professional but show a genuine love and concern for the dogs.  My dogs have attended training and daycare since they came home with me.  I have and will recommend Dog U (Birmingham) to anyone looking for a good training, boarding and/or daycare facility.  Another plus is they are located next to the Vet...so you can know there is a medical professional in the event there is a problem!

name: Andy Bernstein
text: Everyone was so kind to our new puppy Willow!!

resp.text: Hi, Andy. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Meredith Parker
text: I trust Dog U completely with the care of my two dogs, Lady (2 years old) and Maggie (12 years old). Lady was a 6-month old puppy when she was first introduced to Calvin and Andrea. Lady has attended intensive day care and group classes, and I do not have the words to express the positive changes in Lady’s behavior through working with Calvin and Andrea. Through group classes, I have seen first-hand Calvin’s knowledge, patience, and passion for dogs and their well-being. In addition, Lady and Maggie attend regular day care and always come home happy and tired from a full day of play! I also have the peace of mind that their amazing vets are on-site, and I have the convenience to add-on grooming/baths/vet services all in one place. There is no better place for my dogs than Dog U!

name: Jamison McClurg
text: Nice new fences. Real good job at keeping dogs separated

name: Brandi
text: Super friendly and professional staff. They helped train my German Shepherd and socialize him which helped tremendously with his anxiety

name: pedro martinez
text: We are really pleased with this place

name: McCall Rizzo
text: Love this place! Great trainers and staff. Super professional and great with our dogs!

name: Brantley Wilson
text: I am new to the Daphne area and chose the Dog Ranch based on proximity to my house as well as the wonderful customer reviews. My dog was groomed at the Dog Ranch, and they did a wonderful job! However, my dog was diagnosed with Kennel Cough one week after getting groomed. This is the first time this has happened to my dog, but it makes me hesitant to return.

name: Connie Cummings
text: My Basset Hound has been going here for 4 months and we absolutely love it, the staff are friendly, and professional, we use grooming for his nails very often and find they do a great job. I love getting feedbacks about how his day has been and whom he played with, when we pick him up, he is sometimes muddy and dirty, this just shows me that he had a great time playing. My pup loves coming here to play, no complaints on our end.

name: Stacey Kulp
text: Absolutely astonishing establishment! My dog gets excited just going to the car these days assuming this is where she's going & she can even tell when we don't make the turn. We would never take Millie elsewhere. Dog Ranch Resort is unbelievable in every aspect.

name: Brandy Morrison
text: I love that the dogs don't pace in a small area. My dog is always exhausted when we go home.

name: jesse olive
text: My dog loves this place! He gets to play a lot and comes home tired but happy.

name: Kassidy Ferrie
text: I had never taken my dog, Bardi, to daycare before and was super nervous about it. Bardi takes some time to warm up to other people but after 2 days of daycare at the Dog Ranch I could tell she LOVED it. All of the staff are friendly and professional and you can tell they love dogs! We also took Bardi to the puppy training class at Dog Ranch Too with Ben (the owner) and he was so helpful. If you’re looking for daycare/boarding for you dog this place is the best!!

name: James Kretz
text: Never been , but I hear that this place is great 👍

name: Ray Hudson
text:
Delilah loves Dog Ranch Resort. Especially Doggy Daycare, the entire staff is exceptional, no matter if she is being groomed, boarded or being trained.  There is a great Comfort to know they  really care about my baby girl.
I really appreciate that.

name: Tera McGill
text: Absolutely horrible business!  I had my dogs booked to be boarded while we went on vacation.  They had already been to the facility a couple weeks beforehand to be tested and spent a whole day there and passed the test.  I brought them on the morning we were leaving and before I finished filling out paperwork they brought my dogs back to me and told me they could not keep them because one was being aggressive.  This was 4 hours before our flight was scheduled to leave.  I asked what was the purpose of the test, why didnt they figure this out then?  It was absolutely ridiculous. I had to make last minute arrangements and it almost ruined our vacation.

resp.text: We are sorry for any inconvenience we may have caused you. Dog Ranch Resort is a dog social environment where all dogs are interacting with one another in some capacity. We do a Temperament Test and Trial Day to give your dogs an opportunity to acclimate into our daycare environment. Most of the time we are able to catch if your dog is a good fit or not. It is not uncommon for a dog to get worse during future visits. They did significantly worse when they came to board. When introduced to the group they were snapping and growling at the other dogs. For the safety of your dogs and all of the other dogs we made the decision to remove them from the group. If your dogs are reacting in a way that jeopardizes the safety of everyone else, it is our policy that they be removed from group and sent home. Safety comes first at Dog Ranch Resort.

name: Kathleen Taupeka
text: WOW! Our furry babies LOVED the Dog Ranch. You are greeted with red carpet service as soon as you pass through the gate. The staff is so friendly and are truly happy to see you and your pups! It's clean and organized and oh so spacious!! You get some amazing photos of all the dogs having the time of their lives!!! We know our babies are in good, loving hands here!!! Give your Dogs a TREAT!!!

name: Josh Bradford
text: My dog has gone here for over 4 yrs.  His care & training is exemplary due to the excellent trainers & Ben Schulman.  I trust Ben implicitly.  Ranch hands are friendly, & professional.  My fur babies love this place & are exhausted when they get home.

name: Crystal Anderson
text: This place is the best place ever to take your pet.  No hassle.  Dog actually wants to go inside! For the first time ever!

name: Haley
text: My dog loves this place!! He always comes home exhausted and I love the Facebook photos they post, so I can see my pup while he's there.

name: Gary Knutson
text: Wonderful doggie daycare, boarding, grooming and training.  Our dogs love this place and the staff.  Maggie and Sadie cannot wait to go there.  We are happy to find a place where we can leave our dogs worry free.  We have boarded them 5 times now for up to a week each time.  Grooming charges are very reasonable for our 2 chocolate labs. 2 thumbs up and five stars to Ben and his staff.

name: Keith Hobbs
text: Top notch place. Very professional and caring. Highly recommend this business.

name: Jessie Quarterman
text: The Best place for your four legged family members to stay or to get a lovely pampering!

name: Megan McKinzie
text: I had previously used Dog Ranch for boarding many times and loved them, but because it had been a year since I last used their services they refused to let me bring my dogs in for day care or to let me board them over the thanksgiving holiday even though spaces were available because and I quote "I am not a valued customer" and services are only available  to their "valued customers".  Their customer service has clearly gone down hill and I am sad to report due to how I was treated by staff I will NEVER use their services again. I cannot support a business that does not value all their customers, not just their regular ones. Disgraceful.

name: Kacey Cook
text: Weve been customers of The Dog Ranch for over 3 years up until today.  Ever since the new administration at the front desk took over, the service has been awful.  I made an appointment for grooming over a week ago, which at that time, I was confirmed  to bring my dog in.  I’ve ALWAYS been hesitant to use their groomer- they really aren’t known for their grooming services but wanted to try them.  They called last night at 6 pm to confirm the appointment and asked me to make sure vet records were faxed over. I questioned why they hadn’t called the vet for them. It’s after hours!  I NEVER had to do that as the staff always did this for us. No biggie, right?   I called the vet this morning, they informed me the Dog Ranch had already called and they received the documents yesterday.  So I called the Dog Ranch as I was walking out of my house to verify they received them.  Apparently they KNEW my dog wasn’t eligible for grooming YESTERDAY but never told me last night when they confirmed his appointment.  When I questioned them on this I was totally blown off and directed to Email the owner with my concerns. Ok, I get it!  I’m 4 days past due on a vaccination. But they knew this yesterday morning!  No call to let me know. Nothing!  Ever since Carly left, the Dog Ranch service has been horrible. I will NEVER be back with our dogs. Common courtesy was avoided. This relationship is over.

resp.text: Mrs. Cook, We are sorry to hear you are so disappointed about your experience. However, it is our policy that all dogs be up to date with our required vaccinations. As we stated over the phone several times, Bentley did not have his vaccines current. Please understand this is a necessary safety precaution we take with all clients due to the high volume of dogs we see every day. When you sign our release form you state that your dog is up to date with their vet records upon arrival at our facility. We are not a veterinarian and can not administer vaccines. It is your responsibility to ensure that your dog is current on all vaccines upon arrival. Please understand that pet safety is our number 1 concern. There are many other grooming options in our area to try. We wish you the best of luck.

name: Lauren Lavender
text: They do a fantastic job with taking care of our furry friends! Our dog gets so excited everytime we arrive and is always so sad to leave!

name: dave rotach
text: After a lengthy move we needed to find someone that we could trust with our fur babies,  the Dog Ranch has fit the bill for us. We have boarded two dogs for a week at a time, a couple times. My  fur kids come home like I used to come home from summer camp. They want to sleep for a week. They are super excited every time we come back to the Dog Ranch for either grooming or another stay.

name: Brenden Tarver
text: Trustworthy an awesome staff. To watch over our fur babies.

name: nicawi46
text:
I have to definitely agree with the reviewer  regarding Dog Ranch’s poorly delivered temperament test. At least, because I saw that review, I was not so shocked when they brought her out within less than two minutes and said “she failed.” The test, as the ranch dude explained, involved taking her into a room, on a leash, where there was already a dog; so she did what I could’ve told you she would do—she barked & cried at the dog.  You definitely have to know what you’re doing if you’re going to introduce dogs on a leash. These guys certainly don’t. When I got there, he just called over the loud speaker “Bring Jackson [their test dog] into room [blah, blah, blah];” then he took my dog on a leash all the sudden and in approximately two minutes he came back out saying that my dog just “snapped at the other dog the whole time.”

My dog definitely barks and cries when on a leash when she sees other dogs—she wants to do what’s natural to her (sniff the other dog’s butt and go play). However, she does well, on or off the leash, meeting other dogs if properly introduced.  I’ve boarded my dog before in several places; she’s had dog sitters and even walkers that come to pick her up with other dogs;  I’ve have always been told how sweet she is with other dogs—those other places probably know more about dog behavior than these guys.  I take my dog to different dog parks regularly and I see myself that she does well with other dogs in her own terms or with me guiding her if needed.

I didn’t really care in the end whether they accepted or not.  It’s their loss in the end. They turned away a perfectly sweet dog and loss hundreds of dollars plus future business. I was looking to board for 11 days while I’ll be in Europe and then again later this summer for a shorter trip.  It’s their loss, not mine.  And if they have no record of my being there—well I did take my intake sheet after they failed my dog so why would you have my info? I called to verify my appointment the day before, though,  so I would certainly hope that they have some record that my dog was there and was “failed,” lol!!

resp.text:
The Dog Ranch Resort is a dog social environment, our temperament test dog has met over 3000 dogs of various sizes, and breeds. Our process is proven to work and is comparable to doggy daycares around the country. The reason we use a leash is to simply get your dog back into the temperament test room. Once your dog gets back there they are simply free to sniff one another.

However, your dog did not want to interact and showed extreme signs of separation anxiety. When Jackson attempted to approach she snapped at him. Due to the fact that she was anxious and reacted in an aggressive manner shows that this environment would be too stressful for her. If she can not handle meeting one dog then it is not fair to subject her to a pack of dogs and jeopardize the safety of our other clients. Safety is our number one priority, there are many other wonderful options in Baldwin county for your pet. We are happy to address your concerns over the phone at any time. You may reach us at 251-929-4899.

name: Matt Mullis
text:
Have taken my husky once recently for grooming services. Staff was very friendly and eager to help. The groomer sat on the floor with my nervous dog until she was comfortable enough to go back. The quality of the work was excellent. The building appears to be TOO plush, IMO. I get what their intentions are but it seemed like over kill (aesthetically). Pricing was slightly higher than what we used to pay by the quality was above expectations. Will absolutely be back.

Would suggest that location possibly partner with local vet to offer same day services like check ups, shots and minor treatments. Anything more involved could be handled elsewhere.

name: Christina Ricks
text: After losing a dog due to a mistake at a kennel, we are super picky about leaving our Vizsla, Honey. However, I feel completely confident in the staff at Dog Ranch Resort! The facilities are clean and well thought-out. She loves it there more than she does at our house, thanks to all the play & fun they have at day care. Keep up the good work, Dog Ranch Resort!

name: Anita Taylor
text: Our dog likes visiting Dog Ranch Resort so much that he never wants to leave. He pulls us in wagging his tail and is never terribly happy to leave. He would live there if he could.

name: Jennie Chafin
text: I have been taking my dog here for a little less than a year now and I couldn't be more pleased. The staff is absolutely amazing and kind (both to me and my fur baby!) and they take amazing care of my dog when I send him to daycare. He gets so excited when I tell him "let's go to daycare!" and when I pick him up at the end of the day he's always happy and exhausted. I have boarded him a few times as well and used their bathing and grooming services and I would recommend any and all of the things they offer in a heartbeat. I can't imagine entrusting my pup with anyone else. Love them!

name: Mark Stovall
text: We were visiting friends at the beach for three days and kept our puppy, Abby, at the Dog Ranch Resort.  It's a wonderful place!  The staff are great with the dogs and Ben sent us video of Abby playing in the large yard.  The entire experience was perfect!  We'll be back!!

name: Brian Henry (WHS ABC)
text: We visited our parents in Daphne and decided to put our Dachshunds at the Dog Ranch for a few days.  The were very pleased with the service, cleanliness, and "amenities" they provided.  We will definitely use them again next time we come down.

name: Paul Oldenburg
text: The Dog Ranch Resort is fantastic!  I think our dog, Tess, likes being there more than being at home with us!  The staff is friendly and professional.  The facility is spacious, clean and bright.  I highly recommend the Dog Ranch Resort!

name: Floyd Bartholow
text: It's a amazing looking place I can't wait To put my furry baby there

name: Troy Bookout
text: They take care of your dog.  Nice place.

name: sonny b
text: Great place to take your dog or board

name: Kay Mecke
text: Daisy and I love Ben and his ranch hands. We have done it all.....obedience,grooming,daycare and boarding!!! Five stars across the board!!!

name: Amanda King
text: I hate leaving my dog in the hands of strangers. But my dog WANTS to go to the Dog Ranch Resort! She can't wait to get out of the car when we get there. That gives me confidence that she's in a great environment when she's away from home. You won't find a more comfortable environment for your dog!

name: Earl P. Underwood, Jr.
text: Friendly experienced staff. My dogs love it.

name: Heather Delker
text: My dog loves it here. They take good care of her.

name: Fletcher Wright
text: Dog Ranch Resort in Daphne is literally a horrible place for a dog. My dog boards at Camp Scotty in Pelham sometimes and it is awesome. I saw the Dog Ranch Resort website and it looked similar. I visit Fairhope help my Mom who has Parkinson's and at times I need a place to board Bailey while here. There were unfriendly on the phone, and very business-centric, not customer-centric, and certainly not dog lovers. I arrived with my 3 year old Cockapoo, immediately heard someone yelling at an employee to keep the dog behind the line??  Then a woman walked briskly up to us, said I have to take her for the "temperament test", took my dog before she was comfortable or acclimated, came back 5 minutes later and said "Your dog was very frightened of our test dog. Sorry she cannot board here, we have lots of big dogs." So I said "let me get this straight, you immediately (in an unfriendly way) take a young dog away from its owner, walk down the hall, open a door where a large Doberman is waiting and because she gets scared you won't take her?" I also explained that she has boarded plenty of times and does great. I even offered the phone number of the place she boards. The woman says "Sir, your dog failed the temperament test."  All I can say in summary is that NO person or place that knows ANYTHING about dogs would design THAT as it's temperament test.  One more thing: I have my data analyst at work check out the reviews and he stated that all but about 3 are bogus owner generated.

resp.text: We are sorry you had a bad experience however, we have no record of your dog coming and visiting our facility. Everything you have described seems off. The Dog Ranch Resort is a very dog social environment and it is suited for active social dogs. All of our dogs are out in separate groups socializing with one another and they are supervised by our ranch hands. We do not just throw dogs in a dog run or a crate. Our Temperament Test Dog is a Chocolate Lab and not a Doberman. Everyone who meets him sees how calm, easy going, and sweet he is. The way our temperament test works is we want to make sure that your dog is good with a new person, a new dog, in a new place while the parents are away. Since you will be leaving your dog in our care we want to make sure that they are okay without you. What we look for is any signs of aggression, anxiety, and overall temperament of your dog. If they show any signs of aggression then our facility can not accommodate a dog that could be potentially dangerous to the other dogs. If we see a lot of fear and anxiety we always suggest a trial day to allow your dog to get acclimated to our environment. We want to make sure your dog is as comfortable as possible prior to boarding. It is also our policy that a "Temp Test" be done at least 2 days prior to boarding in order to allow for a trial day if necessary. Boarding your dog in a new place is very stressful for a lot of dogs so we try to take all of the necessary precautions to make sure that they aren't too overwhelmed. Before jumping in a pool most people test the water, that is the way our temperament test is designed. Our receptionist are required to treat everyone with respect, integrity, and kindness.

name: Brian T
text: Great place. Our dogs love going!

name: lakeguygb
text: 25 a day, But dog seemed to like it. Staff was very nice.

name: David Burton
text: They are very knowledgeable and experienced.

name: Tommy Pate
text: Great place

name: Polly Moonwater
text: Front desk hung up on me while asking questions about boarding.

name: leonor jefferson
text: Love this place!!  They took my rescue puppy right away.  She was matted so bad😭but they was able to clean her up to perfection ❣❣❣.. She is well on her way to getting healthy and a new family that loves her.  I highly recommend this place for your pets.

resp.text: Leonor, thank you so very much for your 5 star review! We are so happy that we were able to get your puppy in right away and clean her up to perfection!! We look forward to seeing you all again very soon!

name: Debbie Shepherd
text: I couldn’t be happier with the service at K-9.  Tim, Denise, and their staff give our sweet Hershey the best care ever!  He LOVES to go there!  It is so reassuring when we leave him, to know that he will be so well cared for.  He has special needs since he is diabetic, and they are so attentive and loving.  Recommend it to all!!

resp.text: Debbie, we are glad to have you as our customer. Thank you for sharing your kind words with us. It means a lot to us and our entire team! We absolutely love having Hershey come stay with us and look forward to seeing you guys again soon!

name: Cathy Sumner
text: They're awesome with our pup Tina. She comes home from her spa day smelling great, looking great, and has her nails done.

resp.text: Cathy, thank you so much for this review. We really appreciate you being a customer. We love that your pup always smells amazing after spa days!! We can't wait to see you guys again soon!

name: Wesley Sparks
text: These folks are great! They give excellent trims and services. We have used them for boarding also. Our dog almost jumps out of the car as soon as we pull up because he loves it there. Sometimes I get text updates about him playing while there. Great business owners providing excellent service.

resp.text: Wesley, we are very excited that you guys come to see us! We absolutely love George W and are thrilled to hear that he loves coming to see us!! Thank you so much!!!

name: Beth Mumaw
text: The groomer did what I asked on my westie.  She has very long legs and I do not  like her clipped too short.  The facility is very nice and clean.  I also liked the idea that she was not there all day.  My dog has anxiety when left too long and they notified me as soon as she was finished.

resp.text: Beth, thank you so much for the wonderful review. We are so happy that you are pleased with your westie's groom. We look forward to seeing you guys again soon!

name: Alvin Irizarry
text: Amazing grooming! I have two miniature schnauzers, and I have never seen them look so good after grooming. This will be the place I get my puppies groomed from now on.

resp.text: Alvin, we truly appreciate that you have chosen to have your schnauzers groomed here. We aim to have all our grooms look amazing and super happy that we accomplished this with you!! We can't wait to see you guys again very soon!

name: Susan Comperda
text: We gave K9 a try after having used another location for the past few years with our doodle and yorkies. We provided a picture of our doodle from a past haircut that we liked. We were happy with the results and the price! We also find them to be very professional in their communication with their customers. The place we previously used was not very professional and pricing had gotten ridiculous. We are happy to have found K9!

resp.text: Susan, thank you so much for such kind words. We are so happy that you guys have chosen to come see us for your doodle and yorkies!! We  look forward to seeing you guys soon!

name: Ashley Wilson
text: I called and scheduled boarding and training for my dog back in March. The appointment was made for May. I call today to see if I can drop my dog off a couple days earlier. I was told their is no longer a trainer at this facility and that I will have to call and talk to that trainer. No one called me before hand to tell me these changes have been made. I talk to that trainer and she has none of my information and had no idea about my appointment that was made. So now I have nowhere to board or train my dog because this trainer is already booked. Tim is the one who took my information and scheduled the appointment. I call to talk to Tim about the issue and he is rude and says he can't do anything about it. I would not recommend using this place. They have Horrible communicating and not helpful when it comes to their mistakes.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience and miscommunication on our part!  We personally do not train; however, we refer you to a trainer. We have had trainers at our facility in the past that we felt were not giving the clients what they needed.  We have found a trainer with 12 years of experiences with all dog training needs.

name: Barbara Arends
text: They do a great job grooming my Yorkie plus she doesn't mind going.  I've boarded her here too and was pleased.

resp.text: Barbara, thank you so very much for the 5 star review! We love seeing you guys!! Looking forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Eric Brugman
text: Best groomer I’ve ever been to. Excellent service and quality work. My dog Noodles has never looked better. Great prices and friendly staff. Definitely going to make them my permanent groomers. I highly recommend their services for anyone looking for a great haircut for their dog.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Eric. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us. We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to seeing Noodles and you again in the future!

name: Melissa 4r5 Bautista
text:
I LUV THIS PLACE FOR MY PUPPY (ROCKY).HE LUVS DAYCARE!!
IT MAY BE OUT OF MY WAY ,HOWEVER I WOULD DO THE DRIVE BECAUSE I TRUST THIS FACILTY WITH MY DOG.KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK !!(THE DAIRY QUEEN AROUND THE CORNER GIVES A PUPCUP OF ICE CREAM )HE LUVS HIS ICE CREAM TOO !!

resp.text: Melissa, thank you so much for such a wonderful review!! We love seeing Rocky who is such a sweetheart! We truly appreciate that you come out of your way to bring him to see us at daycare!

name: Cynthia Beaudry
text:
Oh my word! I am so amazed by this place.

1. Availability: every other grooming place is booked until February. K9 has openings/availability and was able to get my dog in right away!

2. Affordable: absolutely great pricing and a variety of services.

3. Agreeableness: the whole staff was so friendly. I could tell that my dog in good hands. They were so efficient, my dog was done in just a few hours.

This will be my go to place from now on! Thanks so much!

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback. We try really hard to provide a great experience at K9 Bath Body & Boarding and are really happy to hear that you enjoyed it!

name: David Waring
text: Great boarding service.  Very friendly owners.  Always willing to work with us on late requests.

resp.text: David, thank you so very much for the 5 star review. We are super happy that we are able to accommodate you guys!! We look forward to seeing you guys again soon!

name: Erin Coffey
text: I've been on the search for somewhere to board my dog for quite sometime. My lab, Max, tends to be reactive towards men (making it hard for me to find places that will take him). I brought Max out for a doggy daycare trial run at K9 BBB, and even though it started out a little rough, Tim did everything in his power to make Max comfortable with him. The staff is awesome! The trainer there, Angel, has worked so well with Max and given me so many helpful tips. Now Max is always super excited to go see Tim and the staff and play with all of his friends all day! I highly recommended this place for your fur babies, because your pup will be in the best hands!!!

resp.text: Erin, thank you so very much for such kind words!! We are so excited that Max loves coming to see us. Angel and all the staff are the most dedicated to our customers and pets!! We can't wait to see you guys again soon!

name: Luis Vera
text: Amazing service and my babies look so cute. Thanks K-9 Bath Body and Grroming for an amazing service.

resp.text: Luis, thank you for the five star review. We take great pride in making sure that we provide amazing service and are super excited that you guys chose us!! Hope to see you guys again very soon!

name: Nick Mewbourn
text: I carry my dog (Cooper) here ever weekday and he loves it and they are a awesome group. I wouldn't even think of taking him anywhere else!!

resp.text: Nick, thank you for the 5 star review. We absolutely love seeing Cooper, especially at daycare! He is such a sweetheart!

name: Matthew wilson
text: We put our 10 month old lab in for a 2 week board and train, it was like night and day when we got him back. He would always bark and pull towards people and other dogs, and my 10 year old could not hold him back. Now he walks beside you does not bark nearly as much as he used to and also does not pull away while barking. They went above and beyond to help with our lab. And to top it off they are very friendly and helpful even if I have questions or issues they told me to call and they will help.

resp.text: We are so grateful for your kind words. It’s always so refreshing to hear that we are doing a good job! Everyone here at K9 Bath Body & Boarding loved reading this!!

name: Jessica Walters
text: Talk about going ABOVE and BEYOND! The owner, Tim, personally took time to work with my puppy and guide me through a number of behavioral problems. They were incredibly accommodating with last minute daycare and boarding needs, and their trainer, Angel, was SO knowledgable and professional. I don't usually leave reviews, but I was blown away by their kindness and expertise. They GENUINELY CARE. Cannot recommend enough!

resp.text: Jessica,  we are honestly so grateful for this wonderful review! Thank you for being so positive and putting that positivity out into the world. We can't wait to see you guys again soon!

name: Karen Withrow
text: Love this kennel! They have cared & groomed my pup since they opened & I won't take my schnauzer to any other kennel when we are out of town! Great family & employees!

name: Erica Burleson
text: Loved our experience with the friendly staff at k-9! Our sweet dog looked and smelled incredible. Will definitely be returning soon!
