name: Debra McWilliams
text: Everyone that works there takes such good care of my pups!  Drs, Barnett and Stephens are thorough and explain everything.

name: Eric Brown
text: The veterinarian is always very professional and always lets me know any details about my pets visits. The staff there are super kind, would highly recommend others to go to this veterinarian.

name: Kala Bradford
text: We have been taking our sweet fur baby Marlin to this clinic since we got him earlier this year. He's a mischievous little kitten and had to have major surgery this past Friday. I could not be more thankful for this clinic and its amazing, caring and professional staff. I would recommend them to anyone who is looking for a vet for their sweet fur baby. They took care of our Marlin like their own, made sure to keep us updated through the whole process, gave us specific directions for his aftercare and he is now at home healing nicely. We are SO THANKFUL for Helena Vet Clinic and its staff for being so wonderful through this process. You can tell they are all dedicated to making sure all the fur babies are well taken care of!

name: Kelly Benton
text: Everyone was very kind! Doctor Stephens was also very patient with all of my questions and very specific and detailed when he gave me information. I am a new dog owner and had a lot of questions I needed answered for my Doodle Puppy! I also very much like that they will communicate with me via Text Message about whatever I need! Love this place!

name: Chris Parton
text: This is a great clinic! The docs and staff are caring and patient. They have done a great job of adapting to the times during Covid.  Highly recommend!

name: Ashlee Elliott
text: Helena Vet Clinic is above the rest. They have cared for our best buddy since he was 8 weeks old. He is now 7 and has a tremendous amount of allergy issues. They have always been very responsive to his issues, even referring him to a speciality vet when they knew he needed specialized skin treatment. To me that speaks volumes of their professionalism. Dr. Stephens and Dr. Barrett are amazing, as well as Erin and Janet. These are the staff members we interact with most, but every single person we’ve ever encountered there has been like family! We can’t thank them enough for everything they’ve done for caring and treating our Apollo!

name: Donna Robison
text: Very friendly staff, Truly love animals and they take time to make sure every detail is handled.  Available  when you need them.  Definitely would recommend .

name: Jennifer Mamucud
text: Love Helena Vet. They know your pet is family and treat them as such. Very honest and upfront but also compassionate with the bad news.

name: Jennifer Castillo
text: Everyone at Helena Veterinary Clinic was helpful and friendly. They treated Luka as if he was their own. It meant a lot when Christy reached out to ask how Luka was doing after our visit.

name: Donna Robison
text: Very friendly staff, Truly love animals and they take time to make sure every detail is handled.  Available  when you need them.  Definitely would recommend .

name: Stacey Simpson
text: Everyone at Helena Veterinary has just been the best.  We have lived here going on 6 years and have had 5 different pets (4 dogs and a cat) under their care.  Sadly, 2 of our dogs have passed on, but the folks at Helena Vet kept them healthy and happy for as long as possible. Drs. Barnett and Stephens always answer all of our questions, and I've known Karen for as long as we've been using Helena Vet.  She is just so patient and kind and helpful, no matter what is going on.  Janet also has a real heart for animal care and has patiently answered my recent questions about my sweet older dog.  And talk about responsive, they will work with you in any way they can for appointments, medication, whatever the need is. Always return calls. Just can't say enough good things about all of these folks!

name: Joyce Peterson
text: Always a great experience at Helena Vet.  Treat Max like he’s their baby also.

name: Alex Pierce
text: My dog had been attacked.  I pulled into their parking lot. I had no idea they were closed for lunch. They took my dog and saved her!  They managed to keep me updated on every issue.  I can not recommend this practice enough!

name: K Hardy
text: Love Helena Ver! I’ve used them for 20 years! They have always taken great care of my fur babies!! Highly recommend!!

text: Great service, friendly, and take good care of our dog!

name: Rebecca Cannon
text: Dr. Barnett & her team are extremely kind and thoru. They have our girls best interest at heart. Dr. B gave me her time to explain our dogs condition & what the best route to take. Rose, the vet tech, was extremely friendly & clearly loves animals. Even with a mask on, you can tell she was smiling. We will use them again!

name: Pam Malone
text: We are new to Helena. They saw my baby as a work- in, diagnosed her with collapsing trachea and gave me options. She (Theia) is on meds and doing so much better and she’s family to me. I won’t go anywhere else!

name: Ian McDougald
text: My dog wasn’t dying. He got his annual checkups and still isn’t dying. 10/10

text: First visit with my 7 week old puppy. I was very impressed with the staff. They did a very thorough check on her. They were very friendly and excited to help her. Dr Stephens was very knowledgeable with any question I had about raising a puppy. I have only ever had adult dogs. Thank you so much for all of your help! Can't wait to bring my big baby in next!

name: Arif Patel
text:
The nicest of people work there. It seems like they really like their jobs!
Dr. stevens (maybe stephens) was v helpful and gave great advice with non inexpensive recommendations for our puppies health.

For covid: You call if you have when you get there if you have an appointment.

name: Debbie Weissman
text: We like the availability of the vets on Saturday morning due to our work schedule.

text:
I honestly could not imagine taking my baby anywhere else. I moved about an hour away and refuse to go anywhere else.  Any time we need something, they are so quick to respond or get us in.

Both Dr. Stephens and Dr. Barnett always know what my pup needs and they get her fixed up! The whole staff from Janet to Karen and too many more to name, they are the literal best!!

text: I’ve been to Dr. Barnett twice so far to check on my cat who likes to overgroom and rip open healed wounds. She is always so clear on the best treatment for him and though I don’t like taking him to the vet I know he’s in good hands with her. I recommend Dr. Barnett to anyone in need of a doctor for their fur baby.

name: Debbie Turpin
text: Very prompt on time. Very friendly.  Staff were extremely informative and 8nderstanding.

name: Kelsey
text: I took my pet for his first visit during COVID times. They had drive up service. Registration was easy enough. Sadly, it meant no interaction with the vet. Our previous vet retired and we loved him dearly. The kind of vet that grew up on a farm and loves animals is what I've struggled to find since. I couldn't tell you the vet's name here. My pup was fine when returned to me and is up to date on vaccines so I suppose it's okay.

name: Nathaniel Billings
text: The clinic manager was excellent! Dr. Stephens took so much good care of our little fur baby. I’m happy to drive from Hoover to Helena for Dr. Stephens and his clinic!!!

name: Eric Velez Ruiz
text: I don't even know where to begin explaining how amazing HVC was with our baby. Our poor baby was injured pretty badly requiring oral surgery and a lot of TLC. The staff at HVC was very friendly and so helpful! They took excellent care of our baby Chief and were in contact with us during the entire process making sure we were always in the know and making sure we were able to afford our Pups care. I couldn't be more grateful for having the opportunity to work with such an amazing caring staff from the Hospital Manager Janet being so kind and transparent with us to Dr. Stephens dedicating his after hours time and personally calling us after the surgery to let us know how Chief was doing. Needless to say I would recommend HVC for anyone seeking any care for their beloved pets. I am forever grateful for this Clinic and I can guarantee you it is where my Family and I will be seeking out our pet care!

name: Jordan Singley
text: I had the best experience at Helena Vet. It was my first visit and they were able to work me in that day for our sick kitten. The whole staff was so sweet and compassionate. With all the COVID restrictions, only curbside services were available but the staff did an amazing job relaying information to me with multiple phone calls updating me while I was waiting.

Their knowledge in this career is outstanding and I will always go with whatever recommendations they have for our fur family! Would highly recommend! Thanks to the team for becoming a part of our fur family!!!

text: Everyone was so friendly from the moment we stepped into the office until we left!! As a new pet owner, it really gave me reassurance that my pet will be in great hands. This will be my new permanent vet clinic and I will refer everyone I know around the area!

Dr Stephen’s and his staff hit it out of the park again. They have been taking care of our newest fur baby, Asher. They are so excited to see him when he comes in and he loves them as well. He got neutered today. They called twice, keeping me updated and loved on him like their own. You couldn’t ask for better!! Highly recommend!!

text: Saw Dr. Stephens yesterday he was very helpful with my older cat sassy we were on the same page with her care couldn't ask for anyone to be more kind an nice Tk's again...

name: Kayla Abrams
text:
Absolutely LOVE!! 🤗😻
Dr. Wes Stephens is beyond amazing. 😸
He looks at his fur patients as if they were his very own pets. He does everything he can and does not do like most and automatically say, "put the 😐 animal down" 😔 NO, he is about helping the animals and making sure that they are able to live a long happy healthy life! 🤗 He explains everything at an easy way to understand. He takes one day at a time with them, meaning he doesn't throw everything out all at once; he tries to make sure the animals are very comfortable and at ease. He's a great doctor and I am very confident & very happy to say that he is the best Veterinary Doctor that I have ever EVER dealt with. And I am extremely comfortable leaving my fur kids in his care. I trust all his work and his intentions and opinions. 💯

Dr. Wes Stephens helped to save my fur kid's life and I couldn't be more blessed for Dr. Stephens & his work. He knows exactly what he is doing & what is best for these babies. He will not steer you wrong & he is also very very blunt, meaning, he's not gonna lie to you just because it's something he knows you don't wanna hear. He's gonna tell you rather you like the news or not because your fur babies lives are in his hands and he wants them to be able live long happy healthy lives so he has no choice But to be truthfully blunt. I would rather be faced with the bad news and my fur kid receive the help he/she needs than to be Lord lied to about his/her situation and than my baby die or become worse..

Dr. Wes Stephens is the way to go!

name: Anna Davis
text:
Helena Veterinary Clinic goes above and beyond to make the experience as peaceful as possible for both the animals and their owners!

I've always felt like vets may love the animals but ignore the people. In fact, I've often felt patronized for asking questions about process, time, and money. But Helena Vet Clinic has never made me feel this way, and I'm so grateful for the service both to me and to my animals!

I have two cats and a dog, and all visits have been above expectations! One of my cats is very temperamental, and their focus the entire time was her safety. They perfectly balanced that with easing my anxiety and giving me plenty of information about making the experience better in the future. Dr. Stephen's was especially attentive, and you can tell how much he loves animals and cares about his clients.

name: JessicaS
text: These people are amazing! Right when you walk in your welcomed in by their office cat and friendly staff. They have been takimg such care of our elderly dog for several years now. When he started to gain and lose weight we were afraid we would lose him. Their vet knew right away what to check for and right after got him on a thyroid pill and a medication for his cushings disease. This vet has gone above and beyond for us. We travel alot and they are able to send the rx to the pharmacy wherever we go. We have even recieved follow up phone calls and they have filled out travel documents needed for our pets. We love this place and feel they love our babies like their own.

text: Did a great job. Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. Next time I travel will board my cat there without hesitation.

name: Brittany Brown
text: I love love love this vet. the doctor got on the floor and played with my dog and was so personal with her. I have never seen that in my life from a vet; I loved how all the staff members were playing with her in the other room. I could tell by hearing people call her name and one guy was supposedly wrestling around with her. The staff members are passionate about their job and my animal. This was my first visit to this vet and I fell in love. I am moving to Jacksonville Florida and the doctor knows some doctors down there, she took my number down to call me on the names of vets I could go to. I wish I would have found this clinic earlier, not right before I was moving. If you care about your animals like a child i HIGHLY recommend Helena veterinary clinic.

name: Larry Myers

name: Susan B
text: Great service and they didn't mind that the kids tagged along..

resp.text: Susan - Thanks for recommending Helena Veterinary Clinic to other pet owners! We really appreciate it!

name: Devon Bissot
text:
This weekend I brought in a 1-year-old weim mix for a simple nail trimming. They brought it to my attention that he was not being cooperative and would need to be sedated. We passed on this at the moment to discuss the $150 fee they were asking.

They did let me know they were able to get his back paws trimmed. Upon returning home, we found that they completely broke one of our dog's back nails. Not just broke, but practically tore it out of the nail bed. It's sitting 90 degrees from where it's supposed to be.

It doesn't take a genius to think this through...if this was the first nail they tried to cut...then of course he acted out the rest of the time. He was hurt!

If it was the last nail they tried to cut and he had been acting so bad to begin with, why didn't they stop?

And...you're telling me you didn't know you hurt him that badly??? How can this happen and you not see it?

Today, he is at another vet who was able to examine him without any sort of sedation. The nail that was injured by Helena Veterinary Clinic will now cost me $200 to fix.

Helena Veterinary Clinic's response to this...it's my fault. I should have practiced with him daily to get him used to having his nails trimmed. The most ignorant comment ever made.

name: Laura Sparks
text: Dr. P was great! Super friendly staff.

resp.text: We appreciate you sharing your thoughts - thank you!

name: Josh Noyes
text: Great staff and excellent vet. Very loving toward animals.

name: Jamie Daniels
text: Great vet !  Awesome staff!  Love the groomer !

resp.text: Jamie Thank you to you & your pets for being part of Helena Veterinary Clinic!  We appreciate that you are sharing your thoughts about Helena Veterinary Clinic.  Thank you for the feedback!

name: Kacey Hydrick
text: You can tell a lot about the character of the doctors and the people who work in an office by the way they react to an emergency situation. We had an emergency with our elderly dog today and when we called the office, they were not compassionate and seemed bothered by the fact we were having an emergency. I don't expect anyone to stop everything when something happens to one of my animals but when an animal is very old and becomes short of breath and semi responsive, you'd at least think the vet office that you call would at least sound like they care even if they don't. In a brief phone call, it was obvious that the person who answered was not concerned, sympathetic, or compassionate. Luckily, there is another office that we were able to contact, be seen, and send our sweet angel to Heaven within an hour. She was almost gone when we called your office and were told you could see us in about 2 hours like it was just some routine vet visit. I hope that the next time an emergency happens and someone needs help from you in an emergency situation that you'll at least pretend to care even if you don't.

name: Rod Riv
text: Ask around. The neighbors tell us that this clinic refused to issue paper prescriptions in order to force you into using their online pharmacy so they can get a kickback. They wouldn't give me a paper prescription either. Their bitter front desk attendent Debra hates men and tosses around the word liar on a whim. Call three times to set up an appt, and they will clip the nails and claim you never asked to see the vet, but charge for boarding. Will run an exhaustive list of tests and generate a 2000.00 balance when those tests are not justified by the prognosis or diagnosis. Other vets claim they can't follow the thought pattern and charts were poorly documented suggesting tests were run to make use of expensive equipment for a return on investment. The crates are kept behind closed doors because the conditions are terrible. They over-medicated my dog by giving her a 3 year shot twice just so they could charge for it. You'll notice Debra pushing those heavily. Same as companion... Same vets...same staff... Stay away. Be warned or you are sure to experience one of these terrible experiences. All this in just two visits.

text: We are so thankful for your kind, considerate treatment of our old cat Baghera. He was so distraught over having to leave the house, but we desperately needed to have grooming done for his coat and claws before it developed into a life threatening situation. I SWEAR - by the time VIP GROOMING was done with him (in less than 10 minutes by the way), I think old Baggy was wanting to schedule his next cross-town visit! He didn't even cry on the way home! Your staff was wonderful and your experience was evident. We thank you for taking care of our old boy so well - and, even more so (if that's possible), putting us at ease. Baghera is like a new old cat! God bless you all!

My poor boy looks awful with what they did. They shaved him COMPLETELY and cut up hair on his face all wrong. One side is long and the other is completely cut up. I wouldn’t go here again or refer this place to anyone. I’m really sad and upset.

text: The worst grooming of my Yorkie that I have ever encountered!!!! It is definitely not "VIP". My poor puppy had an uneven cut and his head looked the worst. It was as if they didn't even know how to cut a Yorkie a hair. He came back shaved. He literally looks like a little mole rat. His stomach still has dirt on him as if he was not even bathed properly!!!! Definitely not worth the expensive $55. I will never take him here again. I feel so bad that I let my poor pup go here.

They do a great job on my mom's dogs and they bathe my huge dog who has skin allergies! She always feels such relief after a medicated bath!

text: I wish there were 6 stars to give.  After years of terrible to mediocre grooming experiences, we finally found a place that does a phenomenal job with our Goldendoodle at VIP.  We dropped our dog off looking like a mess and picked him up looking amazing. We finally found our new groomers!

name: L Taylor
text: The second time I brought my incredibly sweet, obedient goldendoodle to VIP, she was terrified to go in. I had to basically push her into the back, which I thought was maybe because there are about 10 cats right when you walk in the door. When I came to pick her up, she was overjoyed to see me, which is normal, so I paid and left. After getting my dog in the car, she was acting so weird and pitiful. I went back to ask if they had any issues with her and they assured me that she was one of the most behaved doodles they’ve worked with. Sadly, my dog has been acting weird for over a week and I just discovered that the groomer completely butchered her paws. The nails are cut WAY too short (into her flesh) and she has severe razor burn in between the pads of her paws, which she licks at constantly. After reading the reviews, I completely believe that my poor dog was mistreated and I will never bring her near that place again. Keep your sweet babies away from these people!!

text: Dr. Sneed was the kindest Veterinarian, what a blessing and great care.

name: Artemis
text: Their hours of operation are very convenient for full-time workers, and I can always get an appointment within the week when I call. Everyone on the team is always nice. The surgeries performed on my pets have all been thorough and as inexpensive as possible while still keeping my pets comfortable. The medication is affordable as well. Thank you so much!

text: Always  a good experience.  Friendly  staff and I felt  they were  using safe guidelines  due to the virus.

name: Mikala Mccurry
text: The staff at this location is always excited to see my puppy. He absolutely loves Dr. Sneed and all of the techs there. I also love the convenience of the drop-off appointments and the affordability of the daycare!

name: Curstina Moorer
text: Clean and friendly people

name: Melissa Duke
text:
There is no better Veterinary Clinic out there!! From the time you walk into the door you are greeted with a friendly knowledgeable staff. We can not say enough good about the clinic & veterinarians at Goodwin... They actually care about you and your fur babies NOT JUST YOUR MONEY!!
They saved our baby Bianca's life not once but twice and the 2nd time her odds of survival were very very unlikely, but with their team they beat the odds & she pulled through. Thank God.
In 5 days she will be 12 years old.
We will not take our fur babies anywhere else.
Recommend 100% A++++++++

name: Melinda Welch
text: The vets and staff at GAH really care!  😃

name: Patti Perrett
text: Excellent service

name: Permelia Griner
text: My dog was taken care of and treated like family. The whole staff made you feel important and listened to your concerns and answered all our questions. This is the best place to take your pets too. Well worth the drive.

name: Suzanne Burns
text: We have had our two dogs put down in the last two week.  She was perfect never in a rush, telling me to spend as much time as I wanted.  So kind and soft spoken, sat on the floor with me.  Thank you so much, for making it so loving, to me and my fur babies.

name: Jacob Johnson
text: I brought my dog in for daycare a couple of weeks ago and he was still full of energy and reeked of urine after getting him home that afternoon. Clearly they are not running these dogs hard enough or making them sit in kennels all day long. He was so thirsty when he got home too. Drank the entire bowl of water only to throw it all up a few minutes later. Very disappointed in my experience here and will not be back again.

name: Chuck Hester
text: When our pet (Annie) was hit by a car on Saturday afternoon I called your office on Chantilly after business hours and was connected to an emergency number. After explaining the situation to the young man, he took my contact information and said I would be contacted as soon as possible. Within minutes I received a call from your technician who told me to bring Annie to your hospital ASAP. When we arrived at your offices, we were met by three techs and a doctor who started examining and treating her immediately. All of you staff were professional, proficient, and above all else, caring. I would especially recognize Dr. Jane Sead for the care she is providing Annie in an effort to save her front leg which was severely damaged by the accident. Dr. Snead is very calming and appears to really care about her patients. We've found ourselves a new vet for all our pets!  Thanks to the Goodwin Animal Hospital staff for treating Annie and us so well.

name: Juan Marquez
text: Love this place ...... Great Staff.... My ferret was sick and no other vets would see him without a appointment.... I called Goodwin and they gave me an appointment to see him right away.... Doctors and staff really cares.... THANKS!!!

name: Patricia Allen
text: They are very good at what they do.

name: Jessica Adams
text: If I could give them zero stars I would. I trusted Goodwin with my dog over Memorial Day weekend I was told he was up to date on all his shots by Brittany. When I arrived the receptionist Heather told me that he needed an annual shot and that my total would be $134.00. So I told her okay even though Brittany told me he didn't need any shots. I would just have to pay to board my dog for the weekend. When I go to pick my dog up he has fleas! Also my bill was $200 not $134.00. I asked the older Caucasian Veterinarian that greeted me by the wrong last name why two of employees Brittany and Heather gave me the wrong information he didn't care. He told me my dog needed all the things I was charged. Like it was my fault not the employees. I had to tell him what happened twice so that let me know he wasn't listening or paying attention. To sum it up DO NOT TRUST THIS VET THEY ONLY CARE ABOUT $$$$ and the employees don't know how to do their job.

name: JTF “Ty”
text: We were in a position where our vet had moved to a location that was not convenient for us and we had been shopping around for recommendations. Having known Dr. Goodwin through community activities along with his reputation and recommendations from current clients, we knew we wanted to trust our pets' care there. A situation arose where our youngest and smallest dog was having some apparent GI distress and we called the clinic and Dr. Goodwin took our call and discussed the situation and had us come in. That is a level of customer service you don't ordinarily see from professional-level providers like doctors, lawyers, dentists and veterinarians.  We were greeted by kind and caring front office and technical staff and our pet's issues were addressed in a caring and professional manner. The approach was also conservative rather than a rush to run a litany of tests and get x-rays that might not have been warranted. And it turns out they weren't. After an overnight stay for our pet, we were promptly followed up with by Dr. Goodwin even though it was his day off. We were discharged under the care of Dr. Sterenberg with the same caring and thoroughness of Dr. Goodwin. Our only regret is that we learned during our visit that Dr. Goodwin was retiring and he was the main reason we chose the clinic as our new pet care provider.

name: Charlie Davis
text: Awesome Team!

name: Joseph Bass
text: The Doctors and staff are amazing. You will feel welcome as the staff is courteous and personable. The Doctors are all very professional and knowledgeable. They take even routine visits and procedures seriously, and will be honest and up front with you. We have been extremely happy with Goodwin. They get the big things right, but they always go a step further, for example making quick calls to check on your pet.

name: C. LV.
text: Very friendly staff. My dogs are usually unhappy walking in, but happy walking out.

name: Bill Lewis
text: Always great

name: Bailey Stone
text: The staff here is amazing! We use Goodwin Animal Hospital on Chantilly for veterinary care as well as daycare while we are at work. He is so excited to go every day, and they take great care of him while he is there!

name: Marilyn Law
text: Because they got Jack right in took care of his annual check up gave him his shots that were due and back home we went.

name: Tara Spears
text: Everyone was friendly and great with Koby. They also explained things very well.

name: Kimberly Stewart
text: Goodwin Animal Hospital allow me to feel that I am not just a number when I come in my dogs. The staff has really touched my heart in so many ways. The receptionist knows us and Memphis. Everyone is so kind. I also have complements for the Dr's. We appreciate everything you guys have done for us. Thank you, it really does make a difference.

name: Tommie Scoggins
text: I recently took my Chihuahua to treat his congestive heart failure.  The vet and staff were extremely friendly and were able to get me the right medicine for his condition. This is my chosen that from now on! I love them.

name: Derek Fitterer
text: The staff at the Atlanta Hwy location have taken exceptional care of my pet.  I have seen both Dr. Sternenberg and Dr. Lydia Glasscock for routine and same day pet crisis visits.  They are fantastic!  Contrary to others, I believe their prices to be modest or median at most.  I've used several vets over twenty years with several pets until Goodwin Atlanta Hwy has won my permanent business with great care and very reasonable costs.

name: Courtney Aycock
text: The doctors and staff here are great!  Very friendly, and seem to really care about your pets.  Their prices are very reasonable as well.  I'll definitely keep coming back to Goodwin Animal Hospital!

name: Bo Brabham
text: They treat my dogs like their own.

name: J. Craig Holmes
text: While visiting from out of state we needed daycare for our Airedale for one day.  The staff at Goodwin treated us like we were their best clients.  The facilities were as good as any we have ever used, and we have used some great ones.  It was obvious when we picked up our dog that she was already attached to the staff and that they had taken very good care of her.  When back in Montgomery, we will use Goodwin again.

name: Heather Petersen
text: Professional and loving staff

name: William Smart
text: Excellent experience every time.

name: James Sheppard
text:
The staff at Goodwin Animal Hospital has cared for our two cats the past 8 years, and our dog several years prior.  I am not qualified to judge the competence of the vets or support staff as some previous writers felt compelled to do, but I do know that our pets have been treated with kindness and concern, and whatever ailment that any of them had was cured when they left.  You can't argue with success.

We have an older cat that is in the twilight of her years and Dr. Glasscock has been unfailingly attentive and gentle with her on the many occasions we have had to seek help from her.  She is a credit to what I consider a very fine group of people.  The practice is operated as business and not as as a public service, so they do charge for their services.  Imagine that.  So does our family doctor, the guys who do our yard work and the woman who leaves the newspaper.

I would recommend these fine folks to anyone in need of veterinary assistance for their pets.  I miss talking Auburn football with Dr. Goodwin since he has begun spending his time at the new facility, but we are very pleased with Dr. Glasscock.

name: Abigail Hipps
text: The staff were friendly and helpful during our visit. The prices were more reasonable than i anticipated, and we were treated very professionally. We will continue to use Goodwin!

name: Jed Carnes
text: I was very impressed from the receptionist that answered the phone, the technician that started the exam, the doctor who completed the treatment, and the office administrator who finalized the paperwork.  It was an expensive trip but I feel I got what I paid for.  The staff was great but ultimately they helped get my dog healthy!

name: m mcdougal
text: My poor dog could not stop scratching and it made her miserable . The next day after her visit to you she can rest with no scratching. Thank you

name: Cissy Davis
text: Love these guys and gals. Been using them since 1998. Treat my fur babies with lots of love.

name: Jonathan Robertson
text: Hands down arguably the best animal clinic around! The staff is really polite and they make SURE that they'll do anything to see your pet feel better. Thanks everyone at that clinic for making my moms happy and fixing Toby up from his god awful accident.

name: Misha Pookie
text: I have used Goodwin Animal Hospital for over 8-9 years.  I love the staff and the Vets.  They obviously love the animals and go out of their way to make sure your furbaby is treated well and as comfortable as possible.  I have had to use their services for elder animals last visit and, though heartbreaking, my babies and I were treated with care, affection and respect for the process.  They work with you and great service.

name: Jim Shelton
text: I am so very grateful that the doctors are knowledgeable and willing to work on rabbits. My experience at Goodwin Animal Hospital is always wonderful. Great facility, highly recommended.

name: Ken Furman
text: An extraordinary group of people who offer stellar customer service to its 2 legged and four legged customers ... there could not possibly be a better Veterinarian Clinic/Hospital/Pet Resort in the greater Montgomery area (and dare I say anywhere in the world!!).  I feel blessed when I have the opportunity to recommend Goodwin to friends ... and am rewarded when they too report back to me how blessed they and their pets are to have discovered Goodwin!  My pup spends so much time being loved and cared for at Goodwin's Day Care that I honestly think he considers my home his second home!  :-)

name: Rachel Cox
text: I always feel welcomed by the front desk staff. They're all great and very helpful. Dr. Glassclock is the sweetest vet.

name: Jean Maccinile
text: Been going there 15 years they care about your fur babies

name: Kalyn Pinkerton
text: So my review is from 2014. I took my cat in for a UTI back in November of 2014. He was seen by Dr. Goodwin. I was told he was blocked and had to have a surgery that would basically open up his urethra. So he had the surgery and he came home. He wasn’t getting better. Still in complete pain, losing weight, and straining horribly to use the bathroom. Not only that but he now has a gaping hole in his rear that is exposed to outside air and bacteria and causing infection. We went back to Goodwin in December for them to redo the surgery. Still not successful. At this point he’s being boarded at the Chantilly facility for constant observation. Looking back I’m assuming because they knew they had messed my baby up. So January rolls around and he’s not better. Weight loss, no appetite, and clearly in pain constantly. Dr. Sermon(?) decided to take over and redid the surgery AGAIN.  At this point my cat has been boarded there for over a month and has had THREE SURGERIES. Now I have a cat with constant issues at this point. They said the surgery was effective. WRONG IT WAS NOT. I’ll put a pic in the comments of his rear on the regular due to this complication. He couldn’t even sit down comfortably. He couldn’t walk like a normal cat. And he was constantly crying out in pain and straining. I switched vets at the point and had to spend the next three years of his life at routine visits every 2-3 months to have him sedated and antibiotics and his rear cleaned up. This constant pain eventually took a toll on him. I paid hundreds for prescription food and frequent vet visits and all Goodwin did for me was take a couple grand off my bill and left me with still around a $2k bill for them ruining my cats life. He recently died at only 6 years of age due to his poor quality of life and constant pain and infection caused by this surgery. I’ve investigated this with an attorney and I’m regretful I waited this long as it is outside of the statute of limitations for malpractice or Goodwin would have a lawsuit on their hands. I truly believe they single-handedly ruined my cats life and caused him to be taken from me way too soon. Do not trust these idiots with your babies.

name: Bonnie Powell
text: At Goodwin Animal Hospital the doctors and staff are always extremely helpful and can answer just about anything about any question you may have. The pet resort they have as well is the best in town!

name: James Weaver
text: Goodwin Animal Hospital is amazing inside and out. It is very inviting and filled with an organized, professional staff. I have been going there for years and plan on keep going.

name: Rachel Cox
text: I always feel welcomed by the front desk staff. They're all great and very helpful. Dr. Glassclock is the sweetest vet.

name: Michelle Williams
text: Expensive , but you get what you pay for, professionals in every aspect, great knowledgeable Veterinarian, I recommend this Business

name: Amanda McLemore
text: I called freaked out because my dog had an unknown abscess rupture and i was put on the phone with a Dr right away and she helped me figure out what to do to help my dog! Greatly appreciated!

name: Gale Masters
text: I was really pleased at what a great job Goodwin Animal Hospital did for my sick dog. They gave me very clear instructions that I could understand for the medication and in no time she felt better and she was very happy.

name: Agnes Carter
text: We were very pleased with how well Dr. Goodwin was able to explain everything to us. Th condition and recommendations were very clear and we highly recommend Dr. Goodwin, the staff and services available at Goodwin Animal Hospital.

name: Jean Maccinile

text: Goodwin Animal Hospital provided an excellent service for my pet. The waiting time was not that long and at other animal hospitals I find myself waiting forever! But not here.

text: Goodwin Animal Hospital provided an excellent service for my pet. The waiting time was not that long and at other animal hospitals I find myself waiting forever! But not here.

text: The whole staff is great!!

name: Kenny Harper
text: The staff at Goodwin Animal Hospital care about your pets. The wait time when I check in is short compared to other places I have been too.

text:
(Translated by Google) This place is excellent, the staff is very friendly☺☺

Este lugar es execlente ,el personal es muy amable☺☺

name: Cheyenne Martin
text: Moulton Vet Hospital always has me covered when it comes to any of my pets or livestock. They are very responsive, and they take the very best care of all animals. I have always had great customer service! I know that when I take an animal to them they are in the best hands!

name: Geana Mitchell
text: They take good care of of our dog when we board her there.

name: Branch Beech
text: Tried twice to schedule an appointment. Each time they said they would call us back but never did. If you're looking for a responsive vet, don't waste your time here.

name: julie mclemore
text: Dr. Lee and his staff at Moulton Veterinary Hospital go above and beyond in caring for your pets, as well as in customer service. We are grateful to have them caring for our 4 legged family members. If you haven’t been there, try them out! You will see! :)

name: Kathy Graham
text: I love MOULTON veterinary hospital and the care they give the animals and the owners of the animals. They are compassionate and take care of all involved.

name: Rose King
text: He looked at our midget white turkey when no one else would.  He was very helpful.

name: Debbie Rappuhn
text: I am Debbie Rappuhn, President of Heart of Alabama Save Rescue Adopt!  We have started taking all of our pets to this clinic because we have run out of places in our area that care about our rescues enough, and what we do to help us with fees.  I am so very impressed with their kindness and service and they are paying it forward in my view, to help animals in need!  Thank you from our HASRA team for caring for our babies in the most loving way!  We really appreciate you kindness and service!!!!

name: Wendell Chambers
text: Took our dog who had parvor “they said”. She is acting like she’s better. That’s not the issue. When we got her back she had blood all over her and a big whole in her chest with infection coming out of it. Had to ask about it and medicine for it. Also charged us 562$ and never mentioned how much it would be until we get there to pick her up and said we couldn’t leave with her until we had the full amount

name: Sabrina
text: I was extremely pleased with the quality of service my pets and I received here. We brought in 2 female cats to be fixed on two different days and they scheduled and preformed the surgeries quickly efficiently. Procedure cost a little more then at other places but not extremely pricey either. Also the cats barely had a incision mark or anything else. The cats were well taken care of and back to normal in no time. I am happy to say I will recommend this place to others.

name: Jennifer Garrison
text: Very knowledgeable and takes great care of our pets and livestock.

name: Dawn Hogan
text: What a difference the laser therapy did for Willie’s ear today!!  He was constantly shaking and scratching at his ear and after the laser treatment he was so much better within an hour !!!!!  As always Willie got the best treatment by everyone there !!

name: feliceyia vickers
text: Took my 8 year old Maltese in for a grooming and last minute which was amazing because they let him in on such short notice . The price was also great for a wash and the nails being clipped were included with the service. But my concern is about dogs behavior. My Maltese name is prince and he is normally very energetic when he goes for car rides. But, yesterday he was very drowsy and Extremely thirsty. Prince even threw up soon as he got inside of the car once I picked him up from the groomers. He seemed so out of it yesterday ! Not sure if this place gives dogs anything to sedate them but that should definitely be discussed if so! Especially on an empty stomach! I was told to bring him him at 10:30 am but was told that he had 15 dogs in front of him so he’ll be ready by 6 pm (closing) which is definitely no problem but That’s a very long time to go without food or water. My other concern was about my dogs cut, his back hair was choppy and the ears were choppy as well and very uneven. His tail also looked like it was left to air dry and not combed out at all.

name: Carl James
text: Do not take your pet there. Very unkempt in appearance dog cages stacked on top of one another dogs running around. The shampoo is over the counter cheap stuff my dog had outdoor dirt on his paws I picked him up and he still had the same dirt his coat is not well groomed all in all it not a good spot if you care for your pet. Southern Paw is by far the best.

name: Jenna Beattie
text: I've only used this facility for boarding because I don't have a dog that needs to be groomed, so that's where my review comes from. This is a family owned business that truly cares about their pup customers. They are located in a great area. They take good care of my dog when I have to board her. Their prices are low enough for me to afford which is always a plus. The husband and wife pair are friendly, caring, attentive to you & your animal's needs, and deserve all the business of this area. I have had no complaints with this business and would recommend to anyone!

name: Sharleen Baskin
text: They was great to baby and  I  know my little Miss Fendi is a hand full ... But they took care of her... I will be bringing  her  back....

name: Christopher Todd
text: We have a 1.5 year old Siberian Husky. We love to take him there for services and boarding. Prices are great, the owners have a heart of gold. Definitely recommend this place 🐕

name: Judy Flint
text: They really  love what they do and very friendly  family business.

name: Francine Sanders
text: They always do a great job grooming my dog and they know my dog by name. The only business that I’ve trusted my dog with and they have never disappointed us.

name: Tyler Sellers
text: They took care of us with a last minute booking and we're very accommodating.

name: Gene Emmerich
text: Great people and my dog loved going there.

name: Pat Corlee
text: I took Sha Sha there today.  The parlor was so clean.  Sha Sha was so pretty when I picked her up.  Was very pleased  how Sha Sha looked.  She will  go back😅

resp.text: Thank you so much Ms. Corlee! We love having Sha Sha here! She is such a sweet baby! We look forward to pampering your pup!

name: Timothy Grantham
text: Owners definitely do a great job. I would trust them with my kids/dogs anytime.

name: Jessica Abbott
text:
My husband and I love boarding our dogs here. One of our dogs got sick one night he was there and the owners spoon fed him some soft food. The next morning, they went back to the dogs an hour earlier to make sure he was okay. I am so grateful for the special care they gave that day. It won me over. I will always take our dogs to them because I trust them!
Also, if you take your dogs here for daycare or boarding, watch their Facebook page (Maddy's Pet Resort) for daily pictures of your pups! ❤️

name: David Mcdonald
text: She informed me without meeting my GSD that it would not do good in her boarding.

name: Michael Estrada
text:
We love this place as much, if not more,  as our dog does.  It's like dropping him off at his "grandparents" and knowing they love him as much as we do.  Love the Facebook picture updates, too!  A nice touch and a great way to see our boy is having fun every day.
Highly recommended !!!

resp.text: Thank you, so much. Sultan entertains us as much as we do him. He is hilarious to watch and play with.

name: Tammie Stroud
text: I have boarded our dogs there twice in the last few years. They are very friendly and helpful and you can tell they care. When we had to leave them longer than a day they posted pictures of them on their Facebook page and we LOVED seeing them. We love our vet and have boarded them there however, Maddys IS a little resort for them and they have the freedom to go potty and they play with the other dogs. We always take our dogs when we can but if we HAVE to leave them we will always choose Maddy's.

name: Louisa DiLeone
text: We've been boarding our small dog at Maddy's for years and have been extremely happy with the care she has received. The owners are awesome, personable people who clearly love their customers and their dogs! One time, Maddy's was booked (we waited until the last minute to call) and we had to take our dog to another local boarding facility. It was nothing like Maddy's and I worried about her the entire time. I would cancel a trip before boarding her anywhere else in the future. Love this place!

name: Jeremy Black
text: Best place in north Alabama to watch your pets. The owners are the most kind people we have met since we moved here, they treat every client's animals like their own. They are great at accommodating all my needs and never once have I worried when I dropped my dogs off for daycare or boarding if my animals needs were not being looked after.

name: Beth Fiorucci
text: Just started taking my puppy, Duke, to Maddy's.  He loves it! Love seeing the pictures they post daily on their Facebook page.

name: Justin Draughon
text: I love Maddy's! This is a great place for daycare and boarding. They treat our dogs like family!

name: Zebulon L
text: Barb and Mike are both awesome and take care of our Bruce Wayne as if he is their own.  Highly recommended!

name: Ruby Winkles
text: Very expensive but suggest you use there doggie daycare

resp.text: I would invite you, a person who has NEVER USED OUR BUSINESS, to call around and price places that offer as much outside play time as we do. Our guests get 6 to 7 hours of out of the room group playtime 4 days a week and up to 12 hours of group play time on daycare days, 3 days a week. Please get back with us when you find another. We are very competitively priced for boarding. One star rating based on one uninformed factor and opinion is unfair, rude and hurtful.

name: Gray Wells
text:
LOVE!
We have been using Maddy's for years- since they started, maybe 10 years ago!
We love the attention our dogs get, Barbara's sense of humor, and the entire operation.

name: Bama Bryant
text: We board our dogs 2-3 times a year for vacations or out of town matters. We usually board with 1 or 2 other places within the area. Decided to call & check prices at Maddy's to compare. We were told the whole spill about what our pets would get & how they'd be treated. It sounded decent until we told them we had 2 Dachshund & a Pitbull, then asked prices. The conversation quickly changed to "oh sorry we don't board those kinda dogs". Those kind of dogs we asked? "Yes Pitbulls" they replied. Instant red flag for me.  How are you gonna stereotype one breed of dog? A dog you've never met. A dog that lives with my 2yr old Son, 3yr old daughter & 2 wiener dogs inside. 2 potbelly pigs & about 30 chickens outside. Who goes to the dog park & has played with many other strange dogs. Who has been boarded atleast 25+ times in his 9yrs of age with no issues. My dogs are like my kids & for someone or someplace to stereotype or judge them on "Their Breed" is outrageous to me! I will never use your business & I will never refer anyone to your business either. Wish I could rate you zero stars! 1 star is to much for your business ranking in my opinion.

name: Linda Pickard
text:
I love Maddys.
It's an awesome place to have your pet.
The owners are all about the care of your furbabies.

name: Tami W
text: My dog looooves Maddy's and so do we. They play with him constantly and Maddy's offers the best value by far.

name: Tim Dalton
text: Great people who take great care of your pets!

name: Jeff Armstead
text: My dogs love it.

name: Susan Caldwell
text: Barb and Mike are the best!

name: Buddy Wachter
text: Very nice people

name: Mora Johnson
text: Love this place!

name: Jayla Gash
text: Pretty professional. I feel as though they should communicate as staff with each better. I was over charged because I asked for one thing and it wasn’t communicated properly with other staff. But the refunded a portion. Also, if my dog is being boarded, and I call to check on her, you need to actually give me details on her well-being. Don’t just say “she’s fine” and you haven’t actually gotten off your butt to check. Other than my last visit, overall I haven’t had any issues.

name: Wanda Sessions
text: Although I'd prefer to be able to come in and stay with my girl, I know she's in the best hands with Dr. McMillan and his staff!

name: Val OBrien
text: My kitty was very ill this week with an infection. The medical staff at PC Animal Hospital were very caring and persistent on making her well. She is recovering well and I appreciate all of them!

name: Krissy Kinsey
text: My cat had to be spayed quickly because of a constant infection. I was concerned about cost because I'm between jobs and they quoted me $160 by phone. When I picked up my kitty imagine my surprise when she stated my bill was $260.....$100 over what they said...this on top of the $100.28 I already paid for the initial exam and antibiotics ! I am now going to struggle just to pay my utilities this month which are already past due. Other than the outrageous prices, they took good care of my kitty. If money wasn't an issue I would take all my animals there.

name: Lee Yates
text:
I can't say enough good about this place the professionalism they cared as much for me as they did of my little sissy girl .at this trying time. They prepared here for me to take her home to her final resting place .From the bottom of my heart Thank y'all

text: We boarded our Bella with this facility over a weekend and they took great care of her. All of the staff was super friendly and you could really tell they LOVE their animal friends. I felt sorry for them at our drop off on Saturday because they were so busy and seemed understaffed. I hope others see a need for more staff here and hire some great people because these ladies were going above and beyond to take care of everyone with the crazy COVID restrictions in place. They never slowed down so I cannot imagine them having to keep this pace every weekend. Our hold time to check in was about 20 minutes but we were happy to wait bc we saw the issue was just not enough hands on deck, nothing else. They were very professional, super sweet, and we are so happy that they will be Bella's new vet facility in Pell City. I highly recommend Pell City Animal Hospital to anyone looking for great animal care.

One of my favorites is Dr Bearden sitting in the floor with me and my golden retriever (talking treatment to BOTH of us). My golden loves to carry her doggie in with her for comfort and they let her with out complaining (as they pick it up over and over). We have had nothing but great experiences here!

name: Trina Barrett
text: I don’t do reviews often. Dr. Farmer is a wonderful vet and I have used him for years. However recently we saw Dr. Bearden. I cannot recommend her under any circumstances. My dog had an obvious deformation in her leg after an accident. Dr. Bearden put her in a splint, took X-rays and told us she would send them to a surgeon. Each week we went back and the treatment plan/diagnosis/story changed. The staff would tell me something different than she did each time. She never sent the X-rays to a surgeon. 6 weeks this went on. (Shame on me for letting it go on so long) On the last visit the dog was dropped off 7am, at her request, for observation without the splint. She didn’t look at the dog or remove the splint until I called at 1:30 for an update. At 3:30 she claimed the dog only had “liganitis” but was still not putting weight on the leg. When I asked about the “dent” she claimed I had never told her about it. Not true, and it was easy to see on the dog’s leg. She wanted to give the dog back without a splint. I had the staff splint the leg and took the dog to another vet. She had to have a metal plate surgically implanted to fix the damage. Because of Dr Bearden’s poor diagnostic skills, I cannot recommend PC Animal Hospital unless you see Dr. Farmer.

text: As I set here and read a couple of the bad reviews. I can't help, but laugh. You have to look at the creditability of the person writing the review. They have taken care of my new born puppies and mother at times when I could not. The groomer Michael is one of the best I have ever seen and cares so much about the animal that he is grooming.  I know there is other places that you could take your pets, but please consider Open Gates Pet Resort for your fur baby needs.

text: Dr. Forrest was great when we took our dog there. He is very compassionate. The reason why I will not go back is because of the front desk lady. She is rude, condescending, and thinks it is ok to talk down to clients because they ask questions. We had a misunderstanding about how much it would cost, the quoted us almost 200.00 below what they actually charged us. One charge for my dogs nail trim while he was sedated before a procedure was almost 18.00.  She is the reason we will never step foot back in that clinic.

name: Brandon Arnett
text:
Let me begin by saying the Vet and his assistant were great. They were kind and compassionate and my short experience with them were wonderful. But the lady working the reception...by far the WORST encounter I have ever had.
I am not one to complain, I do not believe "the customer is always right" and I also understand sometimes you just catch people on a bad day, but even on my WORST day I have never treated another person the way this woman treated me.
Long story short, I took a dog in off the street, she turned out to be pregnant and had a litter of 10 puppies. At six weeks old I vaccinated them and de-wormed them, however one was failing to thrive. She quickly became ill and lethargic. I called to get an appointment to have her be seen. (My regular vet was absolute packed out due to the holiday weekend and suggested I call around to try to be seen as quickly as possible) I booked an appointment with Forrest Vet Clinic for later that day. However, the puppy quickly took a turn for the worst and so I rushed her in to be seen early. I knew enough to know it wasn't parvo (and it wasn't) but the dog was definitely suffering from something serious.

The receptionist greeted me with absolute contempt. While the dog convulsed and whimpered she stood there arguing that I never told her the dog was sick (of course I did but I was too polite to argue) she then curls her lip and says "you probably haven't even vaccinated it!" I explained I did and told her the brand used. She goes off on me. Rolled her eyes, told me I wasn't qualified, lectured me about how I had no clue to be buying some shot from a co-op (they were vet recommended and exceptionally reviewed vaccines by the way) all the mean while the dog is suffering terribly and shes too busy rolling her eyes at me to see anything is done about it.
Her terrible behavior continues until I feel about as big as an ant and like I am human garbage. You would of thought I was some back yard breeder who brought in a trash bag of starved puppies and dumped them in her cornflakes.
She continued to roll her eyes and curl her lip and snarl remarks at me until my sobbing 7 yr old whispers to me "mommy why is that lady making mean faces to you?" She announces loudly (but to no one because the place was all but empty) "that dog could have any contagious thing and we don't want it spreading it around. (understandably but come on, have some discreetness)
When the vet saw the pup he was incredibly kind about it, the tech was very compassionate and concerned for my nearly traumatized child who watched the pup convulse and die.
When it was all over I gathered what little nerves I had left and asked through humiliation and tears what the vet would charge to have the puppies de-wormed again at their office. The receptionist snarled yet again and said "Well I don't know. Who knows what you've given them and what you haven't and when!" and huffed at me.
I was tempted to take the remaining 9 (and exceptionally healthy and thriving pups) and dump them in her lap and ask her to so kindly home and feed and medicate and adopt out a group of rescue mutts in the middle of summer.
I was doing everything I could to keep this litter out of the humane society and it's been no easy financial or emotional task, but this cruel ladies absolute lack of compassion and decency had be more humiliated and disgusted then I have ever been. I had to pull over on the way home and just cry from the stress and humiliation of the entire experience.
I am not a breeder, these were rescues, I intend to ask no money for any of these precious puppies, and until I find them safe and loving homes I will be footing the bill for vaccines, food, etc. It's expensive and stressful but I am not some careless human garbage and never should of been spoken to as such.
So beware. It's a shame because the rest of the clinic seemed absolutely lovely, but I would crawl through hot sand and razor blades before I ever faced that woman at the desk again.

text: I took my 4 month old kitten Gracie to be spayed and get her vaccinations and boarded her for a week. They were supposed to call me after her procedure they didn't call so I called them to check on her they said she did well. On Friday when I called to tell them I was on my way to pick her up that's when the young lady told me that she had a couple raw spots on her face from rubbing her face on the cage needless to say when I got there and saw her I was very upset it looked very bad I asked if I needed to put medicine on it the vet told me no that they had put cream on it that it would be fine. She also had a bump the size of my knuckle in between her eyes. Well 3 days later it got progressively worse so I contacted them and I asked them what should I do she said bring her in for a checkup. I asked if there was a charge she said yes 50.00 I said I didn't feel that I should be charged since this happened to my baby on their watch so she said let me ask the vet she came back said no charge I then told her i didn't appreciate the way my kitten was treated that I was going to take her else where.  Her response was oh ok. Today I took Gracie to another vet and they said it's a bacterial infection and gave her antibiotics for a week then want to see her again in a week. I will post this to their FB page as well with a picture of my sweet Gracie

name: Griff Perry
text: Never thought I'd be leaving negative reviews on a business, but here I am. My wife and I had our 2 dogs boarded with Madison Animal Care Hospital over Memorial Day weekend. One thing that bothered me is that even though we were back in town on Monday they were closed so we couldn't pick them up. They still charged us for the day they were closed, but refused to let us pick them up. First red flag. When I picked them up Tuesday I noticed they had a green/yellow discharge coming from their eyes. I took them back to Madison Animal Care Hospital to get them looked at. Turns out they both had eye infections. Best part is they charged me full price for the examinations, tests, and medicine. No discount at all even though the most likely cause was from something they got into while being boarded by the same facility. Seems like this business is a little money hungry and they lack respect towards the people putting money in their pockets.
